It was 3 thin sliced breast and lightly breaded which makes it better (too breading makes certain items not worthy) and for the side dish was mashed potatoes!... and what makes these potatoes better than others?.. RED POTATOES &amp; CHUNK BITES!!.. So it&#39;s not all that mushy (hope that&#39;s a word!)<br><br>Reese&#39;s Peanut Butter Chocolate Cake Cheesecake: (10/10) GRAND FINALE was this... ORGASMIC!!!... TWICE!!.. It was just an amazing day with food and the scenery and to top it of with this dessert!<br><br>MOST DEFINITELY I WILL BECOME A REGULAR HERE!!  =D
Service is mediocre at best. The food is predictable, which is good. But they really need to focus on the service aspect in this restaurant.

Someone wrote a 6 dollar tip on my bill and I caught it on my way out. The manager made the correction right and all was well. I don&#39;t know who did it but it was definitely not me. The tip line had 6 on top of it when the manager showed me. Make sure you check your online bill after ever transaction here. Who ever thought they could get away with it means they are brave enough to try or have done it before. It&#39;s only at this location and I have no other troubles at the other CCF. Service was good and everyone was really nice. The manager was nice enough to give my money back. Sadly, that is the last time I am going here. I&#39;ve only been to this location 3 times. And this is the first time someone try to get more money out of me. BEWARE SOMEONE WROTE A 6 DOLLAR TIP on my bill. <br><br>I am sad I have to go far away for my cheesecake.

It&#39;s got a great view. There&#39;s the review. Oh, and of course that famous 25 page menu.<br><br>The food isn&#39;t great, far from it. Nor are the drinks, even though their sangria rings in at a hefty $12 a glass. But if you&#39;re in the Marina and want a view, it&#39;s probably the best bet to satisfy all parties in your group given the crazy menu.<br><br>Me, I&#39;d spend a few more bucks for Paiche, or grab something from Mendocino Farms and make a picnic out of it at the tucked away beach right next to this joint, but that&#39;s my preference.

&#34;We are judged by the company we keep&#34;. Although this has been my favorite CF, they seem to have the idea that using Quality Parking is going to be good for business. Parking here is valet only. I&#39;ve watched it go from $3.50 to $4.50 and now $6.00!  Maybe that will work on tourists but locals know better places to go where the don&#39;t have to be robbed by parking companies.  I&#39;m surprised that Cheesecake Factory allows this and was surprised at the increase as I was just recently here and was really surprised by the $6.00.  The. Attendants laughed and seemed to Think it&#39;s a joke but if Cheesecake Factory doesn&#39;t do something to stop this parking price gauging, they will lose business.  I&#39;ll never park there again. Next time it would probably be $8-$10.

I work for DoorDash and have been here multiple times to pick up food from their to go counter. I can&#39;t speak to the quality of the food - but I can speak to the service. You can stand at the counter for a good 10 minutes with multiple employees walking by you without any acknowledgement that you need help. Then, once you do finally get somebody&#39;s attention they are unhelpful, rude, and the order is never ready. I understand being busy, but this is just bad customer service.

Oh my, what can you say about the cheesecake factory except their menu is about 20 pages long. They serve everything and it is all pretty good. I especially enjoy their salads.  this service is always amazing and prompt. And of course you cannot leave there without a piece of cheesecake. Even if you take it to go it is well worth it. The Godiva chocolate is my favorite

Best location so far in L.A, been 10 times already. Patio has great view (day-time beach, night-time moon). There is a public parking right behind better than waiting valet. Be prepared for line.<br>Service were awesome.

I am deducting the star because they undercooked my wife&#39;s pasta. It didn&#39;t even look cooked. The manager was very apologetic, offered something else to eat and applied a full refund of the item.<br><br>On the positive side my family and I ordered potato tots, fried Mac and cheese (unbelievably good!), salmon, chicken tenders (most tender I have ever tasted!!) and filet mignon (cooked perfectly). The apple streusel cheese cake was good too. <br><br>The customer service was great and I will be back.
This Cheesecake Factory is a cluster. Service is hot and cold, food is very inconsistent. If it weren&#39;t convenient because of its location I would not recommend it.
First time there and had a good time. Good food good drinks. Best pie selection and the best steak. Original burgers my favorite and boiler maker and watch the boats docking

My bill was $130 &amp; I still tipped them 18% because the food was delicious... Beautiful atmosphere but the service was disappointing.. our appetizers came out at the same time our entrees.. sure it happens and I forgive them but the thing that keeps bothering me, even 2 days after, is that one food runner&#39;s comment that I&#39;ll never forget. ( As the appetizers and entrees come out and he&#39;s holding them ) &amp; we said something like this is disappointing because our entrees are pretty big so we&#39;d like to take some time to digest our appetizers before we grub on the entrees. THIS GUY SAYS........ &#34; oh would you like me to pack your appetizers to go and just leave you guys your entrees now?? &#34; ......... LOL are you kidding me? Sadly I&#39;m never coming there again because of his comment. Such a shame.
this place is terrible a manager turned us away from the restaurant because of my girlfriends shirt before we could even come in!!!! what type of fucking shit is that!!!! do not come here!

A bit loud in here but for good reason. This place rocks and is busy. With a 15 page menu and gluten free options there is a dish for everyone here. Service is second to none, these guys and girls know how to treat you like royalty.
The drinks and food were amazing, Dominic was an excellent bartender!! Bourbon &amp; honey was on point  Steak Diane and shrimp scampi was outstanding!!! Thank you for a great night!

Same as any other Cheesecake Factorys out there..<br><br>MAJOR TIP to all my MDR locals...<br><br>Get it to go! This place is swarming with tourists and hotel guests so it is quite the headache, especially for dinner. <br><br>Despite the chaos, service is always good and everyone is friendly enough. Quite dangerous living 2 streets down from here but I&#39;m a sucker for them cheesecakes.

I always depended on Cheesecake Factory restaurants for their excellent service and quality/generous portions of food, but was left very disappointed after our Sunday Easter brunch. Took an hour to get our food and one of the orders was wrong. Our server didn&#39;t even check on us while we waited for a food to arrive. When our food came, it was barely warm. Our server told us she notified the manager but after 20 min, we had to ask another server to contact the manager and the manager told us he was just notified the minute prior.. in other words our original server lied to us. She couldn&#39;t even bring us hot sauce in a timely manner. Very disappointing that this restaurant chain is becoming subpar and more similar to a Denny&#39;s. Save your time and money for another restaurant, we&#39;re done here.
I love this Cheesecake Factory location. If you sit outside you have a very nice view of the bay. The food it&#39;s always perfect and the servers are very friendly.

Found this online...is this real?!?<br><br>* The Cheesecake Factory<br><br>Location: 4142 Via Marina, Marina del Rey<br><br>Close date: July 22<br><br>Reopen date: n/a<br><br>Reason for closure: vermin infestation<br><br>More information, including numerical ratings for all other restaurants, can be found at the health department&#39;s website at <a href="/redir?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.lapublichealth.org%2Feh&amp;s=8862c485a90daf55ba63edf7589727170b2eb210b28c5f9f9a32065fc613cddd" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">lapublichealth.org/eh</a> or by calling 888-700-9995.

We went there for lunch during the week around noon. Even though it was busy, we were able to be seated right away. We had a table outside so we were able to relax and look at the boats while we had lunch. We had not been here for quite a while and I have no idea why. It was fantastic. <br><br>We both ordered off the Skinnylicious menu. For lower (not low) cal menu items they were really tasty. I had the lettuce tacos and we split the shrimp rolls. <br><br>As good as the food and the environment was, the service was the best thing about our lunch. Our server Jeffrey G was great. He had a great attitude, made suggestions from the menu, always smiling, and was right there with iced tea refills. We couldn&#39;t have been happier with the service.

We had a super brunch today, sitting outside and basking in the ambiance.  <br>Our server, Mark L., made sure we had everything to keep us happy.  Our food was great.  Sometimes brunch is the most fun meal to share and we just had a grand time.
Service Is horrible!  If i can give them zero star I&#39;ll do. <br>I won&#39;t be back.
Thanks for seating me right next the busing station love he sound of dropping plates and complaining servers

The guy doing the to go orders is by far the worst. No customer services skills at all really rude and unwelcoming didn&#39;t tell me the price of my food over the phone and basically hung up on me ass soon as he thought my order was done I show up to pay and my food isn&#39;t ready he didn&#39;t even give me a time that it will be. He just walking around talking and playing with employees... I&#39;m literally standing here writing this review watching him do nothing

Super irritated today is Super Bowl and I ordered some food for the game. I called using the Curbside Pick up. When I got there and called the number on the parking sign no one picked answered the phone. I then called the main line and they said they would send someone out. I waited about 6 minutes and no still came out. I then called again and they said they would let someone know again. About 5 minutes past and still my food was still not out. There were people that came after me who went it to get their food and left before me. I wasnt dressed appropriately to get out of the car or else I would have. After about also 15 minutes they finally brought my order out.<br><br>The food was ok. I got Avocado on my salad and they just left it on the side without mixing it in with the rest of the salad like the cheesecake factory in Redondo Beach does. The food didnt seem to live up to Cheesecake Factory&#39;s usual standards.

Unfortunately I hate to put this down as 2 stars but the service here seems to be getting from bad to worse than ever!! Waited 15 minutes before we even got water then we order receive food from another server our waitress finally check on us 1 hour later... that was after we chase down manager for more water &amp; tea! So... food always good but expect to have crappy service! Maybe they need to hire help??

Sat in the bar for a chill meal with my wife, and couldn&#39;t have had a better server than Brendan. Great service, and just a pleasure to have him serve us. Food was delish: Asian chicken lettuce tacos, tossed green salad, and the surprise of the meal... chicken samosa&#39;s. Just what we needed tonight.

Sure, it&#39;s a chain restaurant, but the waterfront location can&#39;t be beat!  There are so few options in LA to enjoy the coast, so being able to relax outside next to fire pits, steps from the sand and chill under palm trees while watching boats go by is a treat all by itself.  <br><br>Now if they&#39;d just get rid of the ads inside the menu...
This place was great wait wasn&#39;t long at all and food hit the spot great place to come if your planning on going to the beach but it was really nice

I have been coming to this location for over 30 years. The last few times I noticed the quality and service is getting worse. But I tried to stay faithful. Yesterday was the worst and I said nome coming to this joint. I took my family for my anniversary dinner. After waiting hour and half we where finally seated. I wouldn&#39;t wait this long but we were told half our in the beginning. I ordered my usual shrimp scampi. It was a ps. Over cooked and terrible. Rest of my family had something to complain also. The woman&#39;s bathroom was out of service for one of the stalls. Overall the restaurant and even the beachfront has gone low class. Filthy and nasty all over. Time to find a better location.

Ordered meatloaf for lunch and it&#39;s really burnt, have to return it, no more meatloaf for me starting today. Bad experience with it anywhere I go. Manager and server really nice and apologetic so everything is ok. Had mashed potato which is really good. Happy tummy. Replaced my food and looks good, but can&#39;t eat anymore ,lost appetite already.
Food is always good here; service is always terrible. I feel bad, They under staff; and I see the waiters running around everywhere but they just can&#39;t keep up.
Extensive menu. Consistently good food and service. This location has a great view of the marina too. Lovely at night

Can I give a 3.5-star-evaluation ? Their service is always something impressive just like my business professor who had a business relationship with Cheesecake Factory said, they always value their customer as most important thing. The food is good, I ordered a shrimp pasta. Although they forgot that I asked for linguini, that&#39;s fine.<br><br>The thing I dislike about is just like my friend said &#34;all old people with coupon&#34;, felt like I was at Texas, noisy kids and typical birthday place...they really need to improve their restroom though, only one sink to wash hands and the paper towel was all over the place. People said that you&#39;ll know how this place is after you saw the restroom. Exactly!!<br><br>Well, service and food, thumb up!<br><br>Environment, thumb down!
This location Stays busy if the main restaurant is busy go to the bottom restaurant its still part of the Cheese Cake Factory it just has less item on the menu.

Can something so ubiquitous in America also simultaneously be a tourist trap? It appears so. This Cheesecake Factory is right off the beach at Marina Del Rey, making it a prime location for out-of-towners and Angelenos alike to dine on predictable food while ooohing and ahhing at a water view. This one has been here for awhile, and it shows. Decor is a bit drab. The staff, though friendly, can be slow, and the food is exactly what you expect from Cheesecake Factory--decent in a formulaic way without being excellent. It&#39;s a formula that works, because whenever I&#39;m visiting LA, 1/3 of the time I somehow end up here with friends or family. So it&#39;s spot-on three stars from my book. Valet parking only. Wait time 1-2hrs on weekends.

We are in town from Houston so I am not sure if the recipes are different so plz don&#39;t take this as negative but ... These are favorites that we always order so I can be critical......<br>1. The buffalo blast was gross. Instead of a buffalo sauce inside the fried chips it was a cheese sauce no buffalo.  <br>2. The calamari was half fried.  <br>3. My daughter didn&#39;t eat her pasta, didn&#39;t like it. <br>4. Margarita tasted like a fruit drink<br>--------Came back next night to try again<br>********Great Job ****Super packed again the Host was amazing he was there the night before and I mean a crowed of 50 ppl both nights and he never once lost his cool was alway professional he was GREAT!!<br>5. A jam pack place with 2 restroom stalls so u have a line at the door and a line at the bathroom and every time the men&#39;s door opened it reaked!!!!!!!! <br>6. Pasta horrible you cldnt tell the difference between the chicken and pasta it was like blah in your mouth the waitress said they possibly forgot to add salt to water. <br>7. Spinach dip chips was stale. <br>8. Why did my original cheesecake taste like the one at Jacknbox!!!!<br>I LOVE  this place but I wasted a total of $200 combined. Very disappointed  <br>Positive. The Host, daughters Oreo cheesecake, the server who relieved our server of a mandatory break.<br><br>Chavonne

The only reason I am giving this place a one star, is because there is no way to give it zero stars, or minus stars.  The service was horrendous and slow.  It took them almost an hour to serve our initial round of drinks which were watered down and tasteless.  The female shift manager with painted eyebrows was incredibly rude, and spoke in a very arrogant, rude, derogatory, nasty tone.  She has no comprehension of customer service.  She behaved antagonistically when questioned, and was on a complete power trip. Cheesecake has lost its way.  Customer service is non-existent at this location.  I would rather starve to death instead of eating a single crumb of bread or drinking a single drop of water at this place.

You and your friends/family can&#39;t decide where to go? Come here, they have everything for everybody. That&#39;s what I love. And everything is delicious.<br><br> Service was great by servers, but hosts may look annoyed. Their the first point of contact, they should be more welcoming and friendly. I would give them 3.5 stars, but they remind you when they bring the check that the tip is not included. Who says that? But the food is good, so I bumped it up.

If it wasn&#39;t for the wait, this rating would be a 5.  This is by far my favorite Cheesecake Factory location.  The view over the Marina is spectacular.  They have outdoor seating on the patio overlooking the water, a lounge area with fire pits, and heat lamps sprinkled all over.  If you prefer to sit inside, they have a decently sized dining room there as well and also have a bar in case you want to grab a bite to eat or a drink before you start your dinner.  Most people choose to do valet parking here because parking can be difficult or a hassle to find in the area.  On a Friday or Saturday night for a party of 4, the wait time was around 40-45 mins around 7:30pm.  They do not take reservations but they try to accommodate large parties.  Although I have never really ate anything bad here, I would suggest going for the Factory Burrito Grande if you want a burrito (it is ridiculously large).  As for good appetizers, I like the Tex Mex Eggrolls or the Avocado eggrolls (these are well known).  Their BBQ chicken pizza is also good, as well as their Chicken salad sandwich, Navajo sandwich, Chicken Piccata, Chicken Bellagio, etc.  If you are trying to be healthy, then they have rolled out a new menu called &#34;Skinnylicious&#34; that has many tasty options that are under 600 calories each (some under 500).  I recommend the Skinnylicious Lemon Garlic shrimp (a decent portion that has a great flavor served with angel hair pasta) , as well as the Skinnylicious Salmon that comes with vegetables.  The menu can be quite overwhelming actually, but do not fret.  It is hard to choose something bad.  And if you haven&#39;t already, definitely try a slice of their cheesecake.  I might be a plain-jane, but I can&#39;t get enough of their Strawberry Cheesecake.  Delicious!

Happy Hour 4-6 pm Monday thru Friday.  Closer to the sea, better the Cheesecake. For me, the Redondo Beach is the best Factory location (your life shouldn&#39;t end until you&#39;re there for a pink sunset). This Marina del Rey spot is my second favorite of Factory locations, if you&#39;re lucky you can grab a seat overlooking the basin. Happy Hour at bar area only, but plenty of seaboats in view. Chicken Pot Stickers, TexMex Egg Rolls, Vietnamese Tacos, Dynamite Shrimp Tempura-style, and Ahi Tartare our happy hour faves. <br><br>Hold on, my woman is in the bathroom, higher than the Empire State. Wait... that&#39;s me, after I&#39;ve had my Tiramisu Cheesecake. She&#39;s going to have to carry me home... tonight.<br><br>Note: You can&#39;t get out of paying for valet here. You would have to park elsewhere quite a distance away for free parking.

I lost my cell phone@ Mothers Beach this evening. I tried to locate it with my IPhone tracker via my IPad. I was not able to connect to internet. An hour went by, and I asked people around to connect to their hotspot, I even went into Foghorn hotel &amp; asked kindly if I could  their guest internet to log in &amp; locate my Iphone / but the receptionist was totally unserviceminded!! <br><br>CHEESECAKE FACTORY MARINA DEL REY -IS MY ALL-TIME FAV RESTAURANT M<br>Luckily after an hour of search I went into Cheesecake Factory, &amp; asked for my cell phone. I first started to talk with The Sweet service minded Quik thinker ; &#34; The Girl w/ The Tattoos - she  forward my request for help to This Sweet Angel Waitress HEATHER. She immediately went &amp; asked the manager for my cell phone. There it was! I&#39;m so grateful THANK YOU THANK YOU THANK YOU HEATHER &amp; The Manager &amp; The Girl w/ Tattoos behind the Deli for helping me to find my IPhone. It&#39;s my work cell phone and all my business contacts. I can&#39;t thank you Guys enough. Thank You
SLOOOOOOOOW service. Everything took forever. Not good. Yelp is telling me to write more, so I&#39;m just writing. Trump is toxic, and he&#39;s the candidate the GOP deserves

I work in the service industry A. So I know a little bit about seating and proper ways to run the restaurant not only to keep customers happy but to ensure the restaurant makes the most money they can on a given night. I go to the Cheesecake Factory ALL the time but leave it to my 21st birthday dinner to have it plummet. When I called they said I couldn&#39;t make a reservation after 5 o clock so they said to show up 30 minutes prior and should only be up to a 30 minute wait. When I got there, there was a HUGE wait but the entire restaurant was completely empty! I was told a 2 hour wait! When I spoke to the manager I got some bullshit excuse that they have a policy that&#39;s states 80% of the restaurant they keep unoccupied until a specific time? BUT YOU DONT TAKE RESERVATIONS AND HAVE HUGE PARTIES WAITING FOR NO REASON AND YOURE LOSING MONEY? Makes a lot of sense. A party of 9 probably would&#39;ve spent $500 and they lost out to what keep a table reserved for a party of 2? Tragic and won&#39;t be returning.

I visited two Cheesecake Factory restaurants in one weekend -- just by happenstance. The Glendale CA location was nice. The Marina del Rey location -- nice also but way too cramped. Cheesecake factory never disappoints in the food department. The food is always delicious, the servers are very good and very amicable. However, this location (at least in the seating area adjacent to the entrance and across from the cake case display) was too cramped. You couldn&#39;t move your chair without bumping the person seated at the table behind you. Also, you knew that the parrty at the next table could hear everythng you were saying at your table. Delicious food though.
Erin was a sweetheart. She gave great recommendations. The Jamaican Pepper Shrimp... YUM!!!! Now its cheesecake time :-) <br>Thanks again Heather for suggesting the patio. We&#39;ve enjoyed the view

It&#39;s a Cheesecake Factory so you know what you are getting into food wise. An extensive menu with healthy to not so healthy options. Kids Mac n Cheese was a favorite with the kids. Not directly related to the restaurant but a definite bonus is the kids big playground just outside on the beach. It was probably the first time ever I was disappointed the wait was only 5 minutes.
Left my phone there last night while buying a cheesecake. Cake was great and their integrity is better.
I love this location, but at night, I waited 30 minutes for service and no server showed up......very angry!!!!!!!!!!

They don&#39;t take reservations so come ready to wait. It&#39;s worth it though.<br><br>The food, service and ambiance was all as I expected to experience at a Cheesecake Factory. It was enjoyable and I would go back the next time I&#39;m craving cheesecake. ;)

So this Cheesecake factory has managed to squeeze it&#39;s way back into my heart lol (prior review). Liz was our server for a short moment, but due to my brief interaction with her I officially declare this my favorite Cheesecake Factory.

Not really a Cheesecake fan....but the location here is excellent (especially if you sit outside on the patio). What you&#39;ll see is part of the ocean (Marina Mother&#39;s Beach) and watch the sunset. <br><a href="http://www.yelp.com/biz/marina-mothers-beach-marina-del-rey#hrid:MVORrfSiEUto0XhzLQtKiA/src:self">yelp.com/biz/marina-moth…</a><br><br>I did enjoy myself the last time I came here. The white sangrias are amazing!<br><br>They only valet here....I don&#39;t think you can park yourself.

This restaurant is a good &#34;go-to&#34; place when you have a group with different tastes. They have an extensive menu that will please everyone. I love the location,right on the bay with views of the Marina. It&#39;s very popular so I do recommend reservations at busy times.The cheesecake is excellent so do try it when you go.

This is a great place to dine with a date, celebrate a birthday or enjoy the view while dinning alone.  I&#39;ve done each numerous times here!<br>It get&#39;s very busy here (as do all Cheesecake Factories), but it is worth the wait.   <br>The food is good, the vibe is right and did I mention the killer view!

Everytime I come for a pick up order here, I&#39;m greeted by the same two miserable employees. One is a heavy set Hispanic female and the other is an older black male. They both clearly hate their job. News flash, if you hate your job, get a new one!!! Always tempted to speak to management but I don&#39;t like getting people in trouble. I&#39;d rather just post a bad review.

I ordered the Caesar salad with chicken and bacon to go. I didn&#39;t get the bacon....  but I paid for it.  Few weeks ago there was a worm on my plate. That&#39;s how they served my lunch.<br> This place is getting out of control. The front desk greeter who seats you has a huge attitude with no smile on her face. Maybe this is not the place to work for your tips....

As a party of 10, we arrived Wednesday night, roughly at 630p. I&#39;m not sure the time frame we were quoted as I was apart of the second car for our party that arrived later. We waited for over an hour to be seated while basically everyone that walked passed us, where all seated right away. It was very busy, so we waited. <br>While waiting, my niece was sitting on the furthest bench to the parking lot outside, also in the spot of the bench closest to the parking lot, and in a white Lexus, valet almost hit her while backing it up directly in front of the restaurant! She didn&#39;t move, but it wasn&#39;t until her Dad tapped on the window did the car stop moving. Not exaggerating, the car was 4-5 inches from her. Possibly closer. <br>While waiting, my husband ordered a glass of wine &amp; a beer at the bar, which took very long to receive. <br>Finally we&#39;re seated. Summer was our server. After 5 or so minutes, she approaches us to tell us that she&#39;ll be with us in a moment. She comes back where we&#39;re all ready to order, waters for everyone except 3 kids drinks, and we ordered our food at that time as well. Bread hits the table- breads get devoured since there were lots of hungry people at the table- my daughter was crying that she was thirsty, I waited and waited and waited for our drinks, finally I got up and walked to the server station to get a water for my child.. a few moments later, water finally arrives. The food took a very, verrryy long time. The waters were never refilled even though we requested it, one child didn&#39;t receive her juice until we were all finished eating, and we were never checked on during the course of our meal either. No additional alcohol or dessert was ordered because we were sure we wouldn&#39;t get it anywhere near on time. By the time we saw Summer again, we needed boxes and our check and one person needed to place a to go order.<br>&#34;What do you want?&#34;, Summer asked him. Straight to the point and not in the friendly way. <br>Overall our server seemed overwhelmed &amp; frustrated, which is totally fine, as long as you&#39;re able to keep it positive, explain that things are taking a few extra moments, and keep in touch with your guests. Instead we were totally ignored and spent a lot of money, really, for less than mediocre service. <br>1 star goes to the ONE gentleman wearing a purple button down, most likely a FOH Manager, who was genuinely friendly when he brought out our food and smiled and greeted us when we walked past him to our table.

I used to think if you&#39;ve been to one Cheesecake Factory, you&#39;ve been to them all. Not so with the &#34;bistro&#34; side of this location! Luckily, we were tipped off by the hostess, who told us there was a much shorter wait, if any, at their adjoining bistro. The bistro looks nothing like a Cheesecake Factory. It looks like you rented a private cabana by the sea and happened to have a huge craving for cheesecake. We were seated in a cozy corner spot, right next to a fire pit and with a great view of yachts in the harbor. Awesome date spot for a summer evening!<br><br>We were in the mood for a &#34;tapas&#34;-style dinner, so we ordered a bunch of small plates to share: fried calamari, crabcake bites, crab &amp; artichoke dip, and margherita flatbread pizza. The fried calamari were crispy but could definitely benefit from a nice marinara sauce instead of the cocktail sauce it came with. The crabcake bites were just as delicious as I remembered! (For whatever reason, I&#39;ve always been fond of crabcakes at Cheesecake Factory.) The dip was a little greasy and salty... not my favorite. The margherita pizza was impressive. The basil was fresh and the flatbread was just the right balance of crispy and fluffy.<br><br>Since we were at Cheesecake Factory and we inadvertently went on National Cheesecake Day no less, we had to get some cheesecake for dessert. Much to my dismay, they were out of Oreo, but the banana creme cheesecake was a wonderful substitute. MM went for the more classic strawberry topped cheesecake and I couldn&#39;t help but steal a bite.<br><br>The service was great and the ambiance was unlike any chain restaurant I&#39;ve ever dined at. For that, I&#39;m definitely a fan!

The food and service were as expected.  In our case, we enjoy the Cheesecake Factory, and this was no different.  Why 2 stars.  We&#39;ve been going to this location for many years, and the parking process was:  If you have a handicapped placard, and if there is a space available, there is no charge.  If the valet has to park the car, there is (now $6.50--a bit outrageous, I&#39;d say).  I understand that, and I accept it.  This last time, the valet had to park my car.  Why?  They had parked a new Porsche in the handicapped space.  When I asked about it, I was told, &#34;He&#39;s only in there for a minute.&#34;  I asked why he didn&#39;t park in the pick-up spot, and got no response.  I complained that I would have to pay, when there really was a spot available.  I was told that everyone now pays.  OK.  When we were done, and left, there was now a new Bentley parked there with no placard &amp;/or disabled license plate.  I told the attendant to move the car, or I would call the police.  He did, but glared at me the entire time.<br><br>Please don&#39;t go to this location that has such lack of concern for the disabled and handicapped

My grandmother loves this location of the Cheesecake Factory! We come every Sunday for brunch. She loves the lemon ricotta pancakes, and my husband loves their omelettes. We ask for Cheyenne when we visit because she&#39;s so friendly and attentive! She remembers our orders and gets everything out quickly. The staff works very hard so even though the restaurant is busy, it never feels like service suffers for it. Between the awesome atmosphere and the view of the marina, this place is the best brunch spot!

Living across the street from the Cheesecake Factory is pretty a blessing and a curse. It&#39;s a blessing because it has anything you could ever feel like eating at a high quality and reasonable prices, plus they are open late, they have a bar, and they have curbside pickup. It&#39;s a curse because having an amazing variety of cheesecake that close to me is just not good for my health. <br><br>Objectively, this place is great other than that it is always busy, they don&#39;t take reservations and you have to valet park ( which kind of seems like a nightmare but I always walk, so to be fair I can&#39;t talk smack). <br><br>My favorite food items are the oreo cheescake, the chicken littles, and the crab dip, but everything is good.

Never coming here again due to service and management. Last night I came with my boyfriend and our two friends (another couple) to celebrate them recently finding out they&#39;re pregnant. My friend ordered for his girlfriend the Fish and Chips entree, but when the food runner brought the entree out it was Fish Tacos. The food runner took the Fish Tacos after we explained the order was incorrect. He came back with the rest of our meals and our server, Kellie, brought back the Fish Tacos and sets them again in front of my friend. We explained to her that order is incorrect. She said, &#34;No, you ordered the Fish Tacos.&#34; Clearly she misheard the order, but instead of staying professional she brought back the entree we didn&#39;t order and accused of us of ordering something we didn&#39;t. To make the situation even worse when she pulled the Fish Tacos she actually said, &#34;Whatever&#34; as she turned and walked away!!! We asked to speak with the manager. The manager, Amanda, came up and said, &#34;I heard there was a problem with the tacos you ordered.&#34; We explained the situation to her. She said the new entree will be coming out soon with no apologies for her employee&#39;s actions. I asked Amanda if she didn&#39;t think it was inappropriate what her employee did/said. She looked at me blankly. My boyfriend explained to her that he used to be a a server and that I&#39;m a server so we know mistakes can be made, but Kellie&#39;s unprofessionalism was unacceptable. She apologized and said she would come back and check on us. She never did!!! We got our check with no meal comp. Just an extremely unsatisfied visit that I&#39;ll be sharing with their corporate office.

We stopped in today to take some church friends to lunch here...it&#39;s a friendly and happening location. Food is consistent to the chain.  Service is friendly.  Definitely an asset to the chain, for sure!  <br><br>It has indoor seating, typical CF styling, comfy and open.  Indoor windows look out on the marina.  It also has a really nice patio that has a beautiful view of the marina...most people wait to sit outside here.  We didn&#39;t, since the couple we brought was elderly...indoor was less bright for them.<br><br>TIP: If you visit, the parking is ONLY valet.  It is $5- cash per car.  (it seems well organized)<br><br>The cheesecakes and cakes looked awesome as usual, but I was too full to try one :(<br>Pumpkin and Pumpkin Pecan are both there now!  Enjoy!

So we&#39;re at the Cheesecake Factory this man allowed his two kids to toss toys and play at my table! I did not say anything until the kid&#39;s toy was almost in my drink and they had to touch me to retrieve the toy. I then asked the father to have his children play closer to his table. He said ok sorry &#34;come here before you catch something.&#34; I asked like what? Manners? Degrees? I have both! I&#39;m upset that I had to say something in the first place! I asked for a manager, who was extremely nice and was just as upset! I thought he handled the situation with integrity and sensitive. Others walked over to our table after we had been relocated to the other side of the patio to apologize and acknowledge the severity of his comment and actions. It was very dishearten.

Never. Ever. Ever Again. As a big fan of The Cheesecake Factory as a no-brainer go to (virtually anywhere) I feel extremely disappointed in my experience over the past weekend at this particular location. First and foremost, I am very aware of the long wait times at all cheesecakes and this review has nothing to do with the initial wait time. As this location is a beachfront location we decided to sit in the beachfront portion which is partially separated from the main portion. After about 45 minutes of waiting, we were seated. I went to the women&#39;s bathroom and it was a one stall bathroom which was filthy. We notified the restaurant. After being seated our waiter came to take the order. I had to repeat myself several times because he didn&#39;t want to write anything down on paper. Also, he acted very odd when we asked for simple requests. Our first request was a bread basket. It took us 55 minutes and asking two waiters maybe 7 times to get the bread basket. Second, I ordered a glass of wine. My wine came in a dirty glass. Since our waiter was long gone my mother decided to take my glass back to the bar to get it changed. After swapping the cup, the bartender told her to tell the waiter and that they should bring another glass on the house. We put in our order and after the 55 minutes when we got our bread we got a notification from the waiter that one of the items we ordered is sold out (which was just grilled artichokes btw). Ok great, tell us after an hour. I opened my napkin and silverware to find that my fork had a very disgusting unidentified something on it. I called another waiter and complained since ours was nowhere to be found. He then made a face himself and took the fork and promised me plastic silverware for me and my family (which never came). The food came all wrong, my aunts margarita had pickled jalapeños on it, and everything tasted not as good as it usually tastes. The waiter brought me another glass of wine after my father had to explain to him that it was dirty and explained to him that the bartender said that it should be replaced. Literally no common courtesy to replace it without an explanation. The waiter was the most odd waiter I have ever had. None of the waiters were communicating with each other either. When we asked for anything it took so long to get it that we just wanted to get out of there. They never cleaned the table they barely wanted to bring us anything we asked for. I felt as if the waiter thought it was a chore. At the end, we got our check and the waiter had TRIPLE charged my wine, which was dirty in the first place, after he brought me a second one. Anyway, we complained to the manager about the check and I started to vent about how its just been an extremely terrible experience. He apologized and told me I should have told him earlier. To end this review, I would like to say that due to the lack of cleanliness that I witnessed in those few hours I would never recommend that anyone I know go here until they fix these issues. As far as customer service goes, the staff definitely needs some help with that. Never at any other cheesecake factory (and I have been to a lot) have I experienced anything like this.

Good food, nice waitstaff but SHADY valet!<br><br>I like this location because it&#39;s right on the water with plenty of outdoor seating and umbrellas!  The staff at this location is super nice and attentive and the food good. <br><br>I took away one star because of the shady parking attendant.  My friend paid for both of our parking .. I SAW her give him the money, said in front of me &amp; the valet she was paying for my parking and after she left he said she hadn&#39;t paid him.  I reminded her that she gave him $20 and I saw him give her change but he insisted I pay him anyway.  I decided I didn&#39;t want to fight over about $4 dollars and just paid him but that&#39;s really shady!  I bet he cleans up at night when people aren&#39;t paying attention and have had a few drinks!  Don&#39;t trust the valet at this location since he&#39;ll cheat you to your face!

Went last night to dinner with my fiance, the view outside is perfect. Valet was okay, but food it wasnt nothing really that special. Her ceasar salad needed more flavor, and well im sure it wasnt there specialty plate, however i would have thought they had amazing top notch food. But i can be wrong. At the end they are a cheesecake specialty you can say, and theyre cheesecake is just great.

Ordered 5 items for delivery through door dash.  Get a call from door dash 30 minutes later telling me they were out of one of the chicken dishes I ordered and I needed to replace the order for the one dish (all other items had been ordered). I went thru door dash again and ordered another chicken dish.  1 hour later I only receive the one chicken dish.  The original order had been completely canceled.  The cheese cake factory should have called me directly to figure out what I wanted to replace the order with.  They have a tablet with all of my information from door dash.   I called and spoke to the manager at tcf and he just put the blame on door dash.    First of all, it&#39;s your fault for having a menu item on their website that is unavailable.  Second, your food must come from frozen bags or else you would have been able to create the original chicken dish.  Very poor management and execution.  The one chicken dish that finally arrived was ice cold and in one word just sucked.
Very disappointed this time and over 30 minutes waiting for our dessert after ordering&#39; tad ridiculous but our server Nica (?) was adorable!
Seriously twenty dollars for five shrimp and some angel hair. Quite possibly the worst meal I&#39;ve ever had at a restaurant.

I went with a friend for dinner. It was incredibly and uncomfortably dark inside. They seated us and we waited for 10+ minutes without the waiter coming by. We told a busser (politely) and rather than taking our drink order or giving us bread, he said &#34;they&#39;re coming.&#34;<br><br>We waited a few minutes longer and went to Islands. <br><br>I&#39;ve been here for brunch before and usually have had a good experience which is why I will give them three stars but this was definitely a zero star experience.

The service was great!  Thank you Andy. The Filet Mignon was perfect. The only reason why I don&#39;t rate it as a five star is because of the vallet parking. Why would you force me to use the vallet parking? Maybe I just don&#39;t understand.

It&#39;s cheesecake factory how can you not love it? The honey and I came here for a Valentines day dinner. I got the usual Angel Hair Pasta with Shrimp and my boyfriend got the Jambalaya shrimp; both were absolutely delicious! Our waitress was super friendly and very quick on refilling our drinks and bread :]<br><br>Also, if you want an extra touch of romance ask for outside seating that overlooks the water front. Trust you won&#39;t regret it!
Great food,and excellent service.Near the beach. I highly recommend this place.

Allow me to start by saying that this is my first horrible experience at cheesecake factory. Normally, service there is great and the food and customer service is above average....but when I tell you yesterday was TERRIBLE it was absoulutely UNBEARABLE. My husband and I arrived to the bar ( where we always sit in order to get FASTER service with food and drinks) for cocktails and food. After waiting for about 40 minutes for bread, one entree and crab bites the bartender informed me that the runner forgot to bring our food....EVEN THE BREAD..... in the mean time... table after table and every other bar patron recieved our food. So after a couple cocktails and no food later I told the bartender that we could just leave if we are not going to be served any food. So he was very friendly about it and got the manager. The manager Amanda came out and assured us that the food would be there right away and was not !! It took another 20 minutes... and the order was wrong !!!! ugggh fast forward..... when she brought out the food again I asked her if it was safe for me to order anything else or would it take another hour.....she reassured me it would come out right away. IT DID NOT ......after another 40 minutes or so I saw Amanda casually pass by the bar and I stopped in asked her ....where are the chicken sliders? To her suprise she asked ...they didnt bring them yet? I told her no...then she went in the back and in about 10 minutes later she brought them out. LMAO.... when I tell you they ruined our entire experience...it would be an under statement. So then, in the end they took the 7 dollar chicken sliders and 7 dollar crab bites off and we paid 20 bucks for our pasta and 61 bucks for our drinks. I also tipped both off the bartenders 5 dollars a piece because they made pretty good drinks. Oh then she had the nerve to ask my husband and I if we were going to pay the bill... AFTER we had already paid !!!!!!!!! TERRIBLE EXPERIENCE. <br><br>Service 2/10<br>Food: 7 1/2/10<br>Valet 10/10<br>Bartenders 8/10

The cheese cake factory is a classic. No matter what you order you&#39;ll have amazing meal. This location was extraordinary in their service. We are that wired couple that takes their one year old daughter out to eat with us. The server was so nice, he brought out a special dish of chopped up fruit for our daughter to snack on while we waited for our food. Great service!<br><br>The atmosphere is really chill here, even though it was busy,it wasn&#39;t loud. The food came quickly after we ordered. I honestly have no complaints about this cheesecake factory, and I would recommend it to all of my friends and family.

Came in the other day for a well needed friends reunion, we had excellent service and delicious food. I usually go to the one in Sherman oaks, but this one is by far my favorite location because of the waterfront deck and beach like cabanas.. If you&#39;re on a date or family outing this is the place to stop in for dinner. Try the banana cheesecake it&#39;s the best!

After a long day of shopping my family and I came to the cheesecake factory to have dinner. An early birthday celebration for my son at one f our favorite dine in restaurants. Upon walking in we were greeted by the host. With a warm smile. I asked her if we could sit at the empty both in the bar section. Which we did. Being that we can in around 4:30pm the dinner crowd wasn&#39;t fully in affect. I thought this would be the perfect dine in time. Being that we just attended CF on valentines day (need I say more) as we sat down we waited to be acknowledged several waitress and waiters saw us made eye contact but failed to greet us, let alone take our drink orders. This frustrated me, our son was fresh out of school and very hungry. When the waitress Courtney finally came over. She was very sweet, seemed knowledgeable about products, but not attentive whatsoever! I believe she has the potential to be a great server but today wasn&#39;t her day. The food was great but the service wasn&#39;t so.... :-(

Coming from Venice Boardwalk and making my way along the marina, this Cheesecake Factory location was the perfect stop along the way back home to WLA this afternoon!<br><br>The super easy ($3.50) valet and immediate patio seating with a view of the marina and the beach was exactly what I was looking for to show off the weather and view of the area to an out-o-towner.  It totally felt like vacation to me sitting out there!<br><br>Server Mark made me happy by letting me tweak the menu item I wanted:<br><br>Guacamole &amp; Chips ($9.95) - sans chips, with carrots and celery instead, made with no salt and no tomatoes.  Chunky, fresh, yummy, and just what I ordered!<br><br>My friend took my advice about the awesome desserts and got:<br><br>Godiva Chocolate Cheesecake ($7.75) - and of COURSE I tried it!  The crust was like brownie, and the AMAZING chocolatey cheesecake was TO DIE FOR.  Smothered with the fresh whipped cream that I love, this was really hard for this carb-avoider to resist.  Damn that was good!<br><br>I&#39;ll remember to come back here even when I&#39;m not with an out-o-towner.  It was just too lovely there to forget!

This was hands down the nicest Cheesecake Factory I&#39;ve been to. I haven&#39;t made it to the original in Beverly Hills, but this one definitely tops the one at the Grove. Waterfront location, right on the Marina, especially if you go to the &#34;Beachfront&#34; section. The great view makes up for the lack of the full menu.<br><br>I came here with my gf on a Fri night, so the place was pretty crowded. I don&#39;t know how long it would have taken to get seated inside, but the wait for the outdoor &#34;Beachfront&#34; was about 5 minutes. This area is pretty big, and it seemed a bit understaffed as the waiters were all quite harried, but that didn&#39;t result in a negative experience. They were all extremely courteous, down to filling the water glass as soon as it was empty (if not before).<br><br>As far as I can tell, everything on the menu is pretty great. The items that cost more than $12 end up actually being cheaper because there&#39;s too much food and you can take half home for another meal. And you can always have as much complimentary bread as you want. Go for the wheat, it&#39;s great. The sourdough isn&#39;t bad, but it pales in comparison.<br><br>The main downside of this location is the mandatory valet parking in the lot in front of the restaurant. Being the cheap suburbanite I am, I decided to just park on Washington (the meters are free after 6) and walk the couple of blocks over instead.

I&#39;ve been here numerous times but never tried the factory nachos. Enough to share with the table. Had a lemon drop and must say it&#39;s one of the best I&#39;ve had. A definate must try is the chipotle chicken pasta. It has smokey savory flavor, with the addition of peas, sweet peppers and asparagus. Ask for extra sauce and some parm to top it off. The best. To finish a nice slice of red velvet cheesecake.

Love this place. Food is great, location is awesome, staff is great and even the prices are great. But the only reason i&#39;m only giving them 4 stars is because they don&#39;t take reservations. Many times I have tried to have my birthday dinner there BUT we have to go and usually wait over an hour just to get a table. I think they should be able to accommodate for a party of over 10 with a reservation without to wait an hour.

Came here the other night with my boyfriend. We ordered delicious avocado egg roll appetizer and yummy mango smoothies. We had the best customer service with our waiter IMAN he was helpful and SO happy! Only down fall was we wanted to sit outside but seats were too close together so we had to ask to be moved inside.

Of the many years I have visited several other Cheesecake Factory establishments, this was the first time I visited this location and let me tell you, it was also the last. I was there a couple days ago, looking forward to having some Cheesecake with my family and as I approach the take out counter, I was greeted by the most rude cashier with the worst attitude (Marion). The first thing he asked was &#34;you getting Cheesecake?&#34; I said yes, and went ahead and let him know what I wanted. I didn&#39;t even want to ask any questions to avoid being yelled at. Once he handed me the cheesecakes, I asked him if the receipt was in the bag. After looking around the counter, he found my receipt and threw it in the bag and under his breath he said &#34;it is now&#34; and that was it. The total didn&#39;t seem right so instead of even bothering to ask this man anything, I decided to call the establishment while I was still in the parking lot. And after speaking to manager (Amanda) it seemed that there had been some miscommunication as far as the rules they had for the deal they had on the cheesecakes for that day (half off). But instead of her apologizing for the error, and the fact that her horrible staff member had the worst attitude and wasn&#39;t approachable, she went ahead practically defended him by saying that I should have read the sign. I decided to contact corporate where they were very apologetic for both their employees actions. The price was the last thing I cared about. It was the simple fact that they have the worst people running this place. Horrible customer service. After going through some of the other reviews, I found a few other people who mentioned this same old African American man with the worst attitude. I&#39;m sure many people have complained and clearly nothing has been done about it. Shame on you Cheesecake Factory.

It was such an embarrassment, they don&#39;t know how to manage their own restaurant. We got a gift card and one of the waiters lost it so we asked what to do, the manager said its fine just keep the receipt with you for next time. We want there a few weeks later with a guest &amp; tried to use the gift card, and they said that&#39;s been used obviously not by us. But the manger didn&#39;t care and embarrassed us in front of our friend and more importantly lost a regular customers due to her lack of good judgment. I still can&#39;t believe what happened. Never going back there again

Wow. Just awful service. Over an hour for our food. My daughters salmon was burnt. My sons hotdogs were legit stinky, like rancid stinky. The waiter just kept forgetting to do everything we asked for. More water, ketchup, anything, he just would plum forget. Also, the waiter dropped some mini corn dogs on my daughter. Like Fresh out of the fryer, scolding hot, corn dogs. He cleared away food from the table without asking, just started piling plates and we couldn&#39;t stop him before it was too late. Just a terrible experience overall. Which is too bad because we just moved across the street from this place and would have likely been here a lot, but nope, not making that mistake again.

Back in the day this was the place to go.  Being from LA, I&#39;ve been to this Cheesecake Factory to celebrate someone&#39;s birthday quite a few times.  So recently I decided to take someone here for their b-day.<br><br>1.  First of all they don&#39;t take reservations.  I think management does this on purpose so if they are fully booked, people might go elsewhere... instead patrons&#39; only option is to get there and put there name down and depending on how busy it is, just wait.  Read the other reviews.  This stinks for big groups.  Granted the staff working there are pretty good.<br>(If you really want to eat at a Cheesecake Factory, the Santa Monica one said they did take reservations during weekdays at their non-peak hours.)<br>2.  Eating outside.  If it&#39;s near dinner time it might seem like a good idea to eat outside.  Especially when we were offered seating immediately on their patio.  I sat with the sun in my face and tried to move the umbrellas over to get some shade but that didn&#39;t help much.  <br>Then when the sun set it got windy and cold.  We did ask them to turn on the heat lamp so that helped.  <br>3.  The view here is pretty nice.  This is my favorite Cheesecake Factory.<br>4.  Prices on their menu.  I noticed on their menu, for some reason they don&#39;t list prices on most of their drinks (other than wine) and their cheesecake.  We ordered the Salted Caramel cheesecake and it was 7.95.<br>5.  The food here has never been that amazing or memorable but it&#39;s definitely above average.  The portion sizes are decent and it seems like everyone is taking leftovers home.<br>On my most recent  visit we did order a salad, the Spicy Cashew Chicken and their steak and salmon combo.  The salad was good, the steak and salmon were fine as well but the Spicy Cashew Chicken has issues.<br>I think they rushed the order and they didn&#39;t cook off the alcohol from the sauce.<br>(I know when I follow a recipe for teriyaki sauce they use either a sake or mirin but when I tried the Spicy Cashew Chicken the alcohol flavor was way too much.)<br>I ended up eating my friend&#39;s dish and most of the break.<br>(The bread is pretty darn good... I&#39;m pretty sure they&#39;re extra sugar in the warm wheat bread.<br>6.  Cheesecake.  If you don&#39;t thoroughly enjoy the meal (like we did) be sure to get some cheesecake.  We had the Salted Caramel Cheesecake and that was pretty amazing.<br>That pretty much saved the night and we left happy.  <br>So if you decide to visit a Cheesecake Factory, make sure you leave room for dessert.<br>7.  Valet Parking.  I think the sign said Mon-Thu for Lunch - $3.50, and any other time is $5.<br>I went in late April 2016 so it might change.<br><br>If you do decide to go to the Cheesecake at Marina Del Ray, keep in mind the food isn&#39;t the best, you&#39;ll likely wait, but the desserts and the view alone is worth a visit.

SLOWEST SERVICE IN THE WORLD<br>OR AT LEAST OUT WAITRESS WAS<br>the people next to us finished their food before we even got our entrees<br>It took them 45 min to get out my hot wings<br>And the people next to us got seated 10 mins after we did <br>The time is ticking and I still don&#39;t have my food....

Alcohol - yes. Full bar.  Mediocre bet selection. Not much to write home about. <br><br>Food - not bad. Pretty consistent every time.  Probably like the pasta dishes best. Good sized apps. <br><br>This location is closest to my work.  Has a good view of the marina so +1 for that. Pretty much know what you are on for if you go to any cheesecake which is probably the goal.

We go here pretty regularly as its my moms favorite restaurant. I like it normally. However we just called to see if we could reserve a table for tonight as my mom and dad want to go there for their silver wedding anniversary. I&#39;m aware that they don&#39;t usually take reservations, but when I started explaining that it was a special occasion they hung up on me!! So annoyed, we go to this place all the time and they couldn&#39;t even be bothered to listen to me for a minute.

Here today at our favorite place in the Marina.  Its super packed but we manage to get a table in the bar area, yaayyyyyyy.<br><br>So our server for today is Greg:<br>First impression of our waiter seems like a cool guy very chill.  We had to wait awhile to get our drinks since he was servicing a lot of tables but he did bring out the bread immediately.  When the drinks came there was something in the hubbie&#39;s drink that didnt belong and Greg had no problem getting that taken care of immediately.  Believe me I was watching him to see any indication of an attitude. <br><br>Anyway i ordered the chicken piccata and sub the rice for mashed potatoes w/ sauteed spinach on the side.  This dish deserves a 5 star rating, oh my.  The lemon sauce is delicious over the mashed potatoes.  The hubbie ordered the Grande Burrito w/ steak and chicken.  He gives this two thumbs up due to the portion size and taste.   FOOD: 5 STARS<br><br>Overall service from our waiter: He started off with a 5 but then drop to a 4 because he didnt ask me how my food was or if I need anything.  Although, he asked my hubbie a question about his food just not me (sad face).   I used to be a waitress so following through and making sure everything is AWESOME is THE top priority.  Now that I own my own business, I make sure everyone gets the best of me at all times.<br><br>We also ordered the Red Velvet and Banana Cheesecake.  Super delicious so another 5 STAR REVIEW.<br><br>LOVE EVERYTHING ABOUT THIS PLACE.

Warning... do not order the chicken fettuccine it was horrible... Not only was it horrible but the manager hesitated to accommodate us.. we went there to celebrate my niece birthday with a party of 12 and five or six people order the fettuccine and have the same result ..It came out salty and watery. And what makes it worse we had to wait 2 hours just to get seated to have this nasty taste in my mouth

If you only knew how much I crave Cheese Cake Factory, you would think I&#39;d give it a 5 star rating but...not.  <br><br>Once upon a time it was a pleasure to dine here but I just don&#39;t feel that way anymore.  Outside dining seating has been reduced to cafeteria style setups and you are literally sitting with strangers that cannot hold a intimate conversation unless you speak in alien code.  I can actually smell what&#39;s on the other guest plates and hear them chew and swallow.  (I don&#39;t know you like that)  I am so sick of valeting my car.  If I&#39;m going pay for something, I&#39;d rather it be park and ride not someone else to park my car where I am very well capable of parking my car.  Sometimes we go late and when dinner is done it should be time to go not time to wait again for my car.  It&#39;s really not as convenient as they may assume it to be. <br><br>The consideration that we take into account is, can we stand the wait.  Which is usually 25-60min. on average.  Do I really feel like dealing with the crowded reception booth that everyone stands around like they have the winning lotto.  <br><br>The food is good and I absolutely come here solely for some outside dining and the Cajun Jambalaya which I find to be a grand cheat meal.  The flavors in it are awesome.<br><br>I came here for my birthday once and the waiter just brought out this tiny sample cup of ice cream...that&#39;s it but another table got a birthday song and a slice of cheesecake.  : - O<br><br>The wait staff are a crap shoot.  Some people are great at what they do and some just need  a job (I get it).  I tip accordingly so, when your service surprises me, I surprise you but when I&#39;m asking myself questions like, &#34;did that just happen&#34;, I&#39;m checking off.  I have a problem with people that lack people skills, working in the service industry. <br>Even though I come here for the food and the ambiance there are some things that get in the way of that fulfilling experience of dining out.<br><br>I gave two stars for the ambiance alone.  Some days its nice to spend a couple hours on the bike path and then head over to CCF afterward.<br><br>The bar seating is a bit crowded but not overwhelming and the TVs are kind of high on the wall and there is no sound when watching the game.  Not ideal but if you find yourself there, it&#39;s doable if you don&#39;t want to miss a particular game.  <br><br>Biggest Con:  That tiny ass bathroom that always need a tiding up.  Two stalls? TH Sometimes I just hold it.  <br><br>The last few times we have ordered our food to go on our way there because they expect a tip if you order from your car and they bring it out.  Naaaay, I can walk in a pay, no problem.  They always forget your condiments even when you ask for them in advance like, bread no butter and sometimes utensil.  They&#39;ll double check your food order but it&#39;s up to you to make sure you have the extras you requested.<br><br>Overall: I will still come here from time to time but 9-10 it will be for take out on a cheat day.  They are not the worst
Great food and service. Amazing view if you sit outside.<br><br>The valet parking however, is a joke. $6 to wait for the valet when it would be more efficient to park our car ourself.

I will admit that I rarely dine  at a Cheesecake Factory. But... I go in almost every one I get near. The strawberry martini is one of my favorite drinks. I have had this drink in Las Vegas, Birmingham, Nashville, Atlanta.  It is always the same. They have this one figured out. It is a vodka based martini.  The strawberries are muddled. They shake the drink and then strain out the strawberry seeds. The glass has a sugared rim with a strawberry on the side. It is tasty, sweet and packs a kick. While we were in Marina Del Ray we stopped in to have a drink on the recommendation of a local. The outdoor options were wonderful. We were sitting right on the edge of the harbor. There was a nice breeze and the sky was such a beautiful color. Our server was engaging. He chatted with us every time he came around to check on us. The cheesecakes that were brought out looked amazing. I wish now I had ordered one.

Horrible service to order items. The person in charge of the orders is rude, arrogant and does not have any sense of customer service! He thinks as if he owns the place.....and doesn&#39;t even show a smile ....i don&#39;t even know how they even have this guy working at such a popular restaurant....bad customer service and you have to pay valet parking or else or park by the liquor store hoping they don&#39;t tow your car....i don&#39;t ever want to return horrible experience. Its so sad because i love CCF but id rather go to the one in the grove rather then this impolite place!

I called to make reservations for my girlfriends birthday, so I could treat her to a nice dinner. Not only was I told that reservations are not able to be made on the weekends, but was also told that she is not allowed to disclose typically how long one would wait on a weekend. &#34;I am not allowed to disclose that&#34;. Seriously? What a joke. Worked in the restaurant business and customer service jobs for years. Talk about lack of transparency. I&#39;ve never eaten here and will continue not to. The lady on the phone was rude, snobbish and I encourage others to not support such attitudes.

This review is for their Buffalo Burger.  All I can say is A-W-E-S-O-M-E!<br>The CF menu is always overwhelming to me because there are so many items to choose from.  But on my last visit, I chose correct!  So good.<br><br>My husband and I enjoy the outdoor patio area.  Very nice on a bright sunny L.A. day.<br><br>And, our server was magnificent.

The Cheesecake Factory never disappoints! Great location and beautiful decor. I love how you have a great view of the promenade from the outdoor seating area. Staff is also lovely and know the menu really well. Will be coming back to this location in the future!

Phillip was AWESOME. I&#39;m glad the switched our waiters. If it was left up to the initial server I would not be giving 5 stars. Phillip is a great asset to your team he was pleasant and upbeat and had a smile the entire time! !

I came here with my daughter for dinner on a Friday night. The place was very nicely decorated and the host and waitress were both very polite. <br><br>Our calamari was good, kind of a small portion but still tasty enough to let that slide. When our meal came I told my daughter to only eat half so we could leave room for dessert. I ordered the Chicken Madeira and ate mostly my mashed potatoes and had 2 bites of  my chicken (this is key info, trust me).<br>We shared the Godiva Chocolate cheesecake and it was sooooooooo good and the Craig&#39;s Crazy Carrot Cake Cheesecake  to go.<br>After a good meal with my favorite person we headed out with our to go bags at hand. The mandatory valet parking is $4.00 which I really wasn&#39;t too keen on.<br><br>Once home I could hear the left overs calling me so I figured what the hell, I&#39;m not one to argue with leftovers. As I went to cut into my chicken I came to the horrible discovery that my chicken was raw, yes it was RAW!!!! I could not believe it, I wanted to throw up! how could this happen? WTF?!!<br>I immediately called the manager and explained to him what happened, he said he could not believe it as that dish was one of their signature dishes. I offered to send him a picture, but he said it was not necessary. I received a $20.00 gift card to cover the cost of the dish and an apology letter a few days after, but I am sad to say That I will only use it for cheesecake, i don&#39;t think I could eat their food again.<br><br>If I were rating only the cheesecake I would give this place a five, but because of what happened with my chicken I cannot give it any more than a two rating.

The Marina del Rey Cheesecake Factory is by far my favorite location of this restaurant chain.  Just about everyone has enjoyed the Factory&#39;s high-calorie, high-taste cheesecakes and huge menu selection.  Most may not know this, but CF was the first true &#34;date&#34; (in Pasadena) my wife and I shared (she picked it because it seemed the best &#34;American&#34; place) so it has a little extra meaning for us.  <br><br>The menu was recently updated. Today for lunch, we tried one new item and one tried-n-true dish.  <br><br>The Farmhouse Burger is new. I guess it replaced the old Ranch House Burger (an old fave). The good news is that the Farmhouse one is $2 cheaper, very unique, and also very good.  It&#39;s an Angus Beef patty covered with Grilled Smoked Pork Belly, Cheddar Cheese, White Onions, Iceberg Lettuce, Tomato, Mayo, and a Fried Egg.  That&#39;s right: Grilled Pork Belly and a Fried Egg?!?!   The egg is a runny Sunny-side Up that oozes all over the burger once you begin to eat it.  Because of the egg, this burger won&#39;t be for everyone, but it sure was an amazing combination of flavors in one very messy burger.  The burger comes with fries, but for $1 extra we upgraded to the delicious Sweet Potato Fries.  My only recommendation for this burger would be to upgrade the lettuce as it seemed to add nothing.  Romaine or possibly spinach would be better.  But I digress.  For me, the Farmhouse Burger is another win for Cheesecake Factory.  Check out the picture uploaded with this review to see it.<br><br>My wife went with her favorite CF dish:  Miso Salmon with Snow Peas and White Rice.  Even the lunch special at $7 off was almost too big to eat.  It&#39;s a classic sweet teriyaki-ish sauce on the grilled salmon that brings  back memories of happy summer days in Tokyo.<br><br>For an appetizer, we tried something new (for us) that isn&#39;t quite new at all:  Stuffed Mushrooms.  They were tasty, however, seemed a little overcooked by about 30-45 seconds leaving a slightly charred taste on the tender mushrooms.  They are stuffed with Fontina and Parmesan Cheese, Garlic, and Herbs served with a Wine Sauce.  The mixture of cheese and wine sauce was loved by my wife who enjoyed dipping the sourdough bread in it.<br><br>Service was great as the hostess seated us quickly and then moved us from our original seat to a better one on the upper outdoor balcony with a great view of Mother&#39;s Beach when we requested some shade under an umbrella. Our waiter was a bit slow at first because the place is seriously busy, but he warmed up to us as the meal progressed and even gave us two To-Go Cups of our drinks: Passion Fruit Iced Tea and an Arnold Palmer. The Arnold Palmer is served in a regular tea glass rimmed with sugar (like Margarita salt, but sweet). It is a nice (and very sweet) touch.<br><br>Valet parking is always $5, so we took the Water Bus over from Fisherman&#39;s Village for $1 each way and enjoyed the ride through the Marina. If you want to avoid valet, there is a lot nearby that offers self-pay spots.<br><br>In addition to the previously mentioned food, my recommendations for any Cheesecake Factory remain the same:  Buffalo Blasts, Avocado Eggrolls, BLT Salad, Jamaican Black Pepper Shrimp, and the Grilled Chicken and Avocado Club.<br><br>Finally, we got a slice of cheesecake to go.  It was a dilemma choosing between the 1200-calorie Red Velvet or the Chocolate Tuxedo Cream. We went the Tuxedo route with layers of Fudge Cake, Chocolate Cheesecake, Vanilla Mousse, and Chocolate. Of course, it was delicious.<br><br>With its nice view, full bar, great selection of tasty specialties, and stellar service, the Cheesecake Factory of Marina del Rey stands out as an excellent dining option if you can afford the wait.

I normally don&#39;t really care for Cheese factory but a good place to go if your out with friends and can&#39;t come up with a place to eat. This location is always packed weekend get even crazier. Overall deserts are great.

Spoke to a less than accommodating, somewhat rude, hostess today. Unfortunately they don&#39;t take reservations as the site says and they will only take your name if you are there in person. Call ahead seating or the ability to make a reservation would be appreciated.

- Huge Menu ((Like, epically large. Jerry&#39;s Famous Deli on crack.))<br><br>- Friendly waitstaff.<br><br>- Equal-opportunity bread service. ((Brown and white chillin&#39; in the same basket... I like that.))<br><br>- Lotsa sneaky places to park off-site, so you don&#39;t have to let some dude park your car and charge you for it. <br><br>- Nice patio overlooking the little inland beach. ((Heat lamps included, for those nippley nights.))<br><br>- Booze city.<br><br>- And yes, as I&#39;m easy to please: FREE REFILLS. Some restaurants are SUCH pricks about this, and I don&#39;t get it. If a restaurant charges over $10 for a dish of food, the sodas should come rolling out. If I can score free refills at McDonalds for $1.39, then I shouldn&#39;t have to deal with shelling out $5 per coke at a place that&#39;s already taking my $12 for a plate of chicken tenders.  ((deep breath)) Okay... settling down. Kind of a pet peeve.<br><br>This spot in particular, next to the Marina&#39;s endless lines of boats, has always served up the fantastic eats. A little pricey at first glance and then you get your order... and holy sh!t, the portions are gar-gantuan. Worry not. Your entree is enough to satiate you; you needn&#39;t order an appetizer, if the budget&#39;s tight.<br><br>That being said, another way to go is to order a couple of appetizers instead of ordering an entree. This is both cost-effective and provides you with some variety, instead of leftovers. <br><br>It&#39;s truly rare that I find myself at a restaurant in which I&#39;m stumped, as far as menu options. The entire Cheesecake Factory menu is appealing. It&#39;s a gift... It&#39;s a curse. Because you want EVERYTHING, it sometimes makes it hard to order, but at the same time, at least everything is good. My poor friend had to deal with my indecision during recent visit; how do you decide which ONE to get when seventy five different things are beckoning. <br><br>The bottom line: It&#39;s all about taste preferences. This is like a TGIF that learned to turn up the quality and diversity of their food a few notches. Yet another restaurant at which you don&#39;t have to ask, &#34;What&#39;s good?&#34; The answer is: &#34;What SOUNDS good? Because everything is good, so if it sounds good, it IS good.&#34; <br><br>In my humble opinion, don&#39;t waste your time with conventional fare, here. ((I&#39;m being a hypocrite, as I order things like Cesar salads here, all the time)) But be a better person than me! Order some crazy stuff. Ideas? Why sure...<br><br>**APPS<br>- Fried Mac-n-Cheese balls<br>- Calamari (Thanks to Tara C. and Trishy B. for the suggestion)<br>- Avocado Eggrolls<br>- Spicy Ahi Tempura Roll<br><br>**ENTREES<br>- Stuffed Chicken Tortillas<br>- Spicy Crispy Beef ((Yes, Chinese.. And it&#39;s one of my FAVES!))<br>- Chicken Romano ((Pounded Chix breast crusted with parm cheese))<br>- Shockingly, the Teriyaki Chicken. ((Don&#39;t hate me, fellow hapas))<br>- Chicken Parmesan Sandwich<br><br>BIGGEST TRIP: Alcoholic Milkshakes. Oh yeah. I&#39;ve had &#39;em. Order an extra shot of your favorite booze on the side; the shakes can be a bit weak as far as booze per volume goes. <br><br>They seem to have a new variety of pizzas that I&#39;ve yet to try... Can anyone say, &#34;Time for a CF DYL Event!&#34; ??<br><br>5 big fat stars. Beware of waits, but then again, in LA, we&#39;re used to that at too many restaurants.
Just called 2 minutes ago. Your guy answering the phone needs to be less rude. Maybe you should pay him more so he can care about his job or fire him whatever works i guess

This is my favorite Cheesecake Factory location.  I like sitting on the patio overlooking the marina, even on a cold night (they have heat lamps).  And it&#39;s open relatively late!  <br><br>I&#39;m not too happy about paying for valet, and the menu is a bit pricey.  the bill usually amounts to ~$100 for two pp (inc drinks, appetizer, entrees, dessert).  But I guess it&#39;s worth it because I&#39;m a regular.  If you haven&#39;t already, try the spinach dip... it&#39;s a must-have for me.  Also, the herb-crusted salmon (minus the lemon sauce, imo) is delicious.<br><br>Great location for a beachside afternoon or local late-night option.  <br><br>ps.  Ask for Ursula.  She&#39;s our favorite!  Sweet girl and great service.

So I&#39;m here with my partner and family. The food was sub par to say the least. The waitress looked like she just woke up from a deep sleep. It took over a hour to get our food and when we got it well it was bad. I ordered the orange chicken and the sauce was like jello literally. The food was cold the drinks were totally bad n man what happened to the good cheesecake factory. Service was bad food was bad and I felt like I got rapped because of course i can&#39;t just walk out.

How can you go wrong with this place!! Definitely one of my favorite spots. The Shrimp Scampi is my favorite. The Firecracker Salmon Rolls &amp; Crab Wontons are the best appetizers!  My #1 drink....Lemon Drop Martini! Great food &amp; service...I&#39;m always coming back!

You come here for the amazing view during dinner... especially if you&#39;re sitting outside.  Its amazing been here a couple times. It&#39;s the cheesecake factory that you know &amp; its pretty much the same everywhere.  Which I actually like, what makes this place special is the scenery &amp; water. I had a good experience each time I&#39;ve visited this cheesecake factory.  Of course I&#39;m sure the company I was with had alot to do with the romantic atmosphere! <br>Service is great, the s&#39;more cheesecake is like a heavenly explosion of chocolate and melted marshmellows in your mouth! Omg its amaballs! <br>And who doesn&#39;t love the bread here yum! <br>Will definitely return for another romantic date night with my .

Excellent food as always, but the wait can be very long sometimes.<br> <br><br>Edit: Someone asked what I got so here is an update: We started off with the fried mac and cheese. Then we also shared a nachos (friend got it as a meal but we had some) and I had the Louisiana chicken pasta.

Be careful when splitting the bill. They list gratuity options for you, but it based on the TOTAL bill not the split portion. It says that, but people don&#39;t always pay attention (a mistake I made today). In my opinion, that&#39;s pretty sneaky. Most places show only based on the split portion. Otherwise, things were fine.

As time goes on, i have noticed that this place keeps getting more and more crowded.  Be prepared to wait.  <br>Funny thing is, i don&#39;t particularly like cheesecake.  <br>However, they have the largest menu of any restaurant i know of (except for Jerry&#39;s Deli).  So Im sure you&#39;ll find something you like.  All the food I have ever ordered has been great.  No matter what.<br>On my last visit i decided to try something new.  I ordered a delish Hawaiian Salad.  What a treat.  Of course, I had to wash down the salad with a piece of chocolate cake (a la mode, of course) - yummy yummy in the tummy.<br><br>I heart Cheesecake Factory . . .i don&#39;t care how ghetto fabulous the peeps are.
