weird. i didn&#39;t realize i hadn&#39;t reviewed this place yet. go figure. eaten here 1,041 times before and i guess i never thought to review.<br><br>this is our favorite CF. it used to be down the street from our old house. parking is valet only, but, not too bad at $3.50 for lunch and $4.50 for dinner. table seating is quick and painless, even if you want to sit outside. we&#39;ve never had to wait more than 10mins even on a busy summer sunday afternoon to get patio seats. staff have always been pleasant and food has always been consistently good. obviously, we&#39;ve got our faves. granted they&#39;re mass produced made to order food, it&#39;s still delicious. my picks are the asian beef strip thing, the basic burger and the chicken salad. i love their lunch specials that come with soup/salad combos.<br><br>this particular spot is right next to a man-made beach, ironically called Mother&#39;s Beach. lots and lots of kiddies enjoy this little stretch of sand and water located just at the edge of the boats. there is also a kids play area with slides, swings and jungle gym stuff just a few feet from the water. it&#39;s a great view from the seats at CF and a great way to work off some of that complimentary bread you didn&#39;t have to finish. :) we just recently discovered the beachside patio seating. easier access to the beach, but, with a limited menu. and by limited, i mean only their top 100 items are on this menu. snap.<br><br>great spot to come out to on a summer day. we&#39;ll keep coming back.

Good place if you know what to get. im a fan of their lettce wraps especially the peanut sauce which is just truly amazing. <br><br>they have good pasta and i like the free bread they serve. you can ask your server for free olive oil and balsamic vinegar to dip the bread into.... so good. <br><br>the cheesecakes are pretty good. especially the red velvet flavor. be sure to check the calorie count though. some of them are As high as thousands of calories per slice.
Food is always good! But Moe the waiter who wasn&#39;t even our waiter is sooo amazing so thoughtful makes sure your happy no matter what I&#39;ll be back because of him!
Always triple check your to go order they always miss out something specially when they&#39;re fully booked.
Came here to spend some gift cards and ended up paying for SELF parking as if me paying for food was not enough love the food but go to another location.

Just had really good food at Cheesecake Factory.  Their portions are very generous and if you have a table on the deck, it overlooks Mother&#39;s Beach.  Nice view, good food, the waiter was very good.  How could you go wrong?  Love the Thai chicken lettuce cups!  Really tasty.

I eat here all the time--great selection and food. Plus they have a fantastic gluten free menu including burgers with gluten free buns. They also have a pretty solid gluten free pasta--not the best I&#39;ve had but good. Great salads they can make gluten free and even a sugar free cheesecake!
Food is always good. Service also. I come here a lot and they know me and my son and are always friendly and welcoming

Wow I have never in my life experienced service or lack there of this horrible. We have our drinks. That is all. We have been waiting for at least 20 minutes for someone to take our oder. I don&#39;t want to say that the staff here is racist but really what other conclusion can I come to at this point for absolutely no service. I can&#39;t comment on the food because well at this pace I don&#39;t think I&#39;ll ever get to try it.

My husband LOVE LOVE LOVES the Cheesecake Factory... probably partially because of the whole NBA-players-love-it phenomenon (Google it!). <br><br>You probably already know about the gigantic menu and often good service, huge portions, etc, so I&#39;ll just get to it.<br><br>LOGISTICS<br>*We used to go to the Brentwood location... until it closed. *SOB*<br>*Unavoidable valet parking for $5... I was super tempted to drive around to find an alternative, but whatevs. It was cold.<br>*Curbside to go is a great option! Review the hugeo menu online, call in your fav, you don&#39;t get to eat as much bread (which could be a good thing...) and you just call when you get there and they bring it out for you with the bill. They run in to ring up your card (who uses cash nowadays?) and off you go! No wait, designated parking spots, and you also get to avoid the $5 parking... win win.<br>*I&#39;ve never known a Cheesecake Factory to not have an annoyingly long wait during anything remotely close to &#34;peak hours.&#34; Dinner at 9pm on a Friday, thankfully, is not considered &#34;peak hours&#34; :)<br>*Have not yet enjoyed the view----I guess that&#39;s why people suck up the $5! <br><br>FOOD<br>*I would rather get half as much food... but it is what it is. Share items, if you can agree on what to order (ha) or ask for a To Go box early so you don&#39;t accidentally-I-mean-uh eat everything!<br>*Thank you, fellow reviewers, for mentioning the Avocado Egg Rolls ($10)--they were GREAT. You get 6 decent sized eggrolls (or I guess it&#39;s technically 3, cut into halves) with a BOMB sauce. I think they&#39;re vegetarian... but didn&#39;t ask.<br>*One of my FAVORITE hidden gems: KALE SALAD! It&#39;s on the &#34;Small Plates and Snacks&#34; page -- not on the Salad... or Side Salad... or Entree Salad sections. Kale salad. $5.95 (!) and a decent size--with the bread and an appetizer or dessert or bites of other people&#39;s food, it&#39;s definitely enough for an entree. I think it has... apples... and almonds? and... other yummy things. Simple, but tasty... and honestly, the Cheesecake Factory is not known for it&#39;s *simplicity* lol. The dressing (which is delish) is not vegan but it&#39;s a pepper-y buttermilk and I remember it (pre-vegan days) being delish! HIDDEN GEM.<br>*Some of my other favorites (pre-vegan): Miso Salmon (loved this so much I obsessively Google&#39;d for the recipe and tried replicating at home more than once), Garlic Noodles, and the Strawberry Shortcake dessert! I&#39;m not the biggest fan of cheesecake (irony of ironies) but LOVE their Strawberry Shortcake... biscuitybready shortcake, vanilla ice cream, and lots of strawberries. *bliss*<br><br>Anyway, we&#39;ll obviously be at the Cheesecake Factory more than I could hope or ask for, but it&#39;s consistent and the selection is great so it is what it is. I would give it 3 stars for the stupid $5 parking and how they&#39;re so obviously contributing to part of why Americans over-eat (lol semi-serious) but whatever--it is what it is! And so much of what they have is good.
I wish there was 2 1/2 stars. My Grandmother loves Salad. She saw her salad and it was wilted. Very Disappointed this restaurant is supposed to be nice.

This Cheesecake Factory was very accommodating.  There was a wait for lunch, but we got seated pretty quickly, maybe because we chose outdoor/patio seating.  The patio here overlooks the gorgeous Marina Del Rey harbor.  With the sun shining and the wind blowing, it probably made the food taste better.<br><br>In all the Cheesecakes I&#39;ve ever gone to, I have never had one bad thing at this place.  This upscale American food chain is as consistent as it can get.  Their best dish is the Miso Salmon - hands down!<br><br>I love their chicken wraps too... !

Now I live close so I have been here a bunch.<br><br>The outside  appearance is beautiful. You can look out or sit outside with a very nice marina water view and they have heat lamps for the girls. <br>The inside appearance is good, but a bit loud.<br><br>For the price it&#39;s awesome, large portions. ;-)<br><br>The wait service was excellent and very friendly.  <br><br>The food was very good, now this isn&#39;t a high class place but again for the price you can&#39;t beat it.<br><br>Now Linda&#39;s Fudge Cake with Ice Cream is my favorites.<br><br>If I had to pick a negative the bathrooms were not the cleanest.  ;-(

As with all of the other Cheesecake Factory locations that I&#39;ve visited, this one put in an admirable performance. Food was good and service was solid. Wait time for an indoor table was not too long (30 minutes). Portions are mostly big and I&#39;d guess that 80% or more of the diners were taking doggy bags with them. Plus, the food is good enough to actually eat it the next day! <br><br>I&#39;m a real picky patron and will comment in the negative on two things. First, I detest being forced to valet park and pay $5. The reason I say that is because the fixed price is $4.50 but the valet had no intention of giving change. <br><br>I also wish they would get under control is the way their &#34;car hop&#34; waiters exit the building. I like their appearance and the way they were speedy in delivering to the waiting customers, but each one of them SMASHED the exit bar on the door... which was unlocked and there was no need to even push the exit bar to open the door. It is a very loud and disturbing noise to keep hearing for the people waiting for a table or sitting in the bar. <br><br>Other than that, it is a crowded and noisy dining room, but one that gives a real sense of fun and being a &#34;happening place&#34;. <br><br>Next time I&#39;ll have to save room for some cheesecake... but I say that every time and it only happens at lunch!
Worst Cheesecake Factory experience ever!! Stay away from this location- horrible service, bugs in the food, rude staff, just to name a few.

Booooo to this place!I went to enjoy dinner and didn&#39;t even get in. The Valet was so rude I could believe it. I didn&#39;t bring cash, which I know I should always have cash for valet in LA, but I didn&#39;t. So I asked him where I could park because I didn&#39;t have cash. He said and I quote, &#34;not here&#34; I told him I understood it was valet and asked where I could get cash, and he said he didn&#39;t know but I couldn&#39;t Parkin the lot without cash.  I a gain told him I understood parking wasn&#39;t free and he told me he didn&#39;t know where I could get cash.  It&#39;s ridiculous to me that a restaurant loses possibly $75-$100 tab bc they only have valet parking with attendants  who are such jerks that aren&#39;t capable if telling me if they have an ATM inside so I can pay them. Get it together!

Feels like this chain is losing its appeal. The service was horrible and they didn&#39;t seem to be very attentive. The place is very small and forget about the bathroom ugh disgusting both genders. The woman&#39;s restroom is tiny and dirty. How can a big restaurant like theirs that is super busy have such a small and dirty restaurant should be a health violation. The food isn&#39;t like it used to be seems like they put half the effort.
Ridiculous. This place is a bus stop. Nasty dirty and gross.

Service is horrible the waitress tried to argue with me over what I did and not did not order then she cut me off and try to correct my order but with an attitude i don&#39;t want you handling my food now. Then I asked to speak to the manager his name was Jonathan he was no help either he didn&#39;t even try to fix the problem I was with two other people i felt that he could have discounted the meal or something. Then near the end when my friends were done eating she went to them individually and asked them did they want desert totally skipping over me. Even though I know what I ordered, regardless she should have said I&#39;m sorry, so what do you want I wasn&#39;t feeling the atmosphere soon as I walked in the door when they say us near the kitchen I would like to eat in peace don&#39;t go to the one in Marina try Redondo or somewhere else. I felt like my mother having to argue like that

The service was slow<br>The fries were lukewarm <br>The service was slow<br>The food was not worth going back for<br>The service was slow<br>Not what I have appreciated about CF in past<br>I guess I won&#39;t rush back<br>Oh did I say the service was slow!

$2.50 for parking during lunch. $4.50 for parking during dinner. Self park or Valet. Either way you gotta shell out the $$. Ridiculous. <br><br>I&#39;ve lived in Marina del Rey for 2 years now and I&#39;ve never actually been to this CF location despite the fact I do enjoy me the large CF menu options and cheesecakey goodness. My friends who just moved to MDR thought we should try it out so I headed over. Quick little drive from my place and I thought to myself &#34;How awesome! So close - I can get my CF fix anytime I want...wait what&#39;s this. Oh valet...I have to pay? How much? Ok can I self-park? I can...but I still have to pay...wth.&#34;  Immediate loss of 1 star. You walk in and it looks rather small at first but after walking through a little maze of tables you get to a larger back area. There is a nice outdoor seating area with cabanas but it was far too cold and dark to enjoy that. <br><br>Our waitress was adorable and sweet - we couldn&#39;t have asked for a more smiley, attentive waitress. Prompt taking of drinks and bread delivery. But then there was the wait for food. I didn&#39;t mind it as I was enjoying good conversation but seriously...my patience was being tried.  Minus another star. <br><br>Eventually the food came. It was standard good CF food. Nothing excitingly crazy but what I wanted. We paid the bill, paid the valet (honestly, it irks me to no end that my meal was $10.95 and valet cost almost 50% of that) and I decided if I ever have any CF craving again I&#39;ll either do curbside or do my waistline and frugal self a favor and not go.

I love this place, but I was so pissed during the Memorial Day weekend.  The restroom should not be a place where kids change out of their swimsuits The restroom is tiny. Sand everywhere. Water on the floor. I slipped and fell. Thank God I am a Choreographer and I broke my fall so I wouldn&#39;t get hurt but my elbow is still soar. Please do better in this area. Thank youl

If you want a girl to fall for you and I mean FALL bring her on a date to Cheesecake Factory in marina del ray, ca right on the beach! First dates are a must here!<br><br>I brought my girl here on her birthday right in front of the beach we had a table and I took her to the front of the ocean and I shouldn&#39;t go on you get the picture after a few drinks life is beautiful. I gave her Birthday present to her right at the beach front. And yea you know the rest. <br><br>The Cheesecake Factory&#39;s menu and food is always amazing no mater where u are but I must say a must have appetizer is the avocado egg rolls. Thank you Cheesecake Factory for having such an amazing location on the beach.
We had lunch there yesterday sitting in the patio.  The service was great and the food was excellent.  It was a great experience!

The service by the host was amazing upon our arrival. Shortly after the waitress service is below zero. She may been new our the store was running with non effective management. One waitress was helping over 20 tables at the same time due to late hours shift. They were short staff not sure if they were cutting hours or worries about over time. We order the food before 3 tables and never got our food. Sure a manager came when we asked for the check without eating our main course due to lack of timing. The manager by the name of Mark came and apologized and started scripting. This place use to always be my favorite. I can assure u that we will never go there again. Service was beyond not effective.

We&#39;ve been going to this Cheesecake Factory for years. Mainly for the signature drink, The Ritz. Beautiful day, off work early and headed start to the Marina.  Got a nice table,waiter comes over, we order 2 Ritz!! Then BAM! Waiter says no more Ritz WTH!! That was it. we just walked out. It was the best drink. We won&#39;t go back, until the THE RITZ is back!!!

I love this place!! We come here all the time and the food is amazing. We were there just a couple of weeks ago and had a slight problem, but I let management know and they not only took care of it they were so gracious and helpful. They even sent me a letter in the mail thanking me for my feedback. Wow! I loved it before, but now even more!!

The food here is always good but the service always sucks. Every time my girlfriend and I come here, we get stuck at a tiny 2 top table against the wall somewhere. They always forget our drinks but when we finally get our food, we almost always forget about the bad.

Many of the other comments summarize what I think. The tables were too crowded - I had a hard time getting out from the table even though I was on the end. The view is nice and is probably why people like this place. The food is marginal at best. We went at lunch time and I ordered a lunch special - chicken romana. It should have been described as a huge pile of spaghetti with a little chicken, The waitress did bring me an extra piece of chicken. I was much better than the original piece. My wife&#39;s salad had to be sent back. It was all wilted and looked very unappetizing. The replacement was OK. Our meals had clearly sat under the heat lamps too long. The people we were with ordered dinner selections. One person&#39;s steak  was large, looked overdone for my taste and was about on par with something from the Sizzler. The last person had chicken picatta, which they said was good. We had dessert. I don&#39;t know how they manage to cram so many calories into one piece of cheesecake but they did (approx 1300 cal each). The key lime cheesecake was reported to be quite good. My white chocolate with raspberry cheesecake was OK. Overall, don&#39;t go here for the food. Go for a heaping number of calories, and for the views. Without the view the rating would have been 1-2 stars. I would rather have had small portions which were well prepared.
1) Waits aren&#39;t as long as the line looks.<br>2) Good food/ good service.<br>3) Numerous seating options, inside and out.

The valet parking sucks to a whole new level. It took longer to get my car than to be seated at the restaurant. The food was great. Our server was amazing, but as we were eating a family came in with a stroller and the manager was so rude ! I have a infant myself and I choose to carry his car seat instead of taking the stroller, but if I had taken the stroller like the family next to me maybe I would of ran into a horrible time. It seemed as the store manager he was a tall light skinned guy with a blue collar shirt. He went off on not only the employee that seated the customer, but also the customer and her family. He was rude to an extremely level. Even though my experience was not as bad as theirs I still had to mention it because I as a customer witnessed the way he talked to the employee and Customers. They made such a scene while I was dinning in that it made it uncomfortable for us so we left. Definitely never visiting this location ever, but instead at a different city. Thanks !

I feel terrible! Me and my girlfriend had a great waitress who fulfilled all our needs. I realized I miscounted and left less than a 50 cent tip when I thought I left 20%. I felt so bad to put are nice waitress through that. I even said keep the change when she took the forty something cents. God was I embarrassed. I realized the mistake walking out and rushed to give her a 30% tip because her service was great and I felt so dumb! If the sweet waitress reads this I apologize for the mistake again!

It&#39;s just like any other Cheesecake Factory with mediocre food. The view off the patio deserves 5 stars but they literally cram tables together. Both times I had gone there it was myself and another friend but it felt like a party of 4 since we were literally sitting adjacent to a table with two other people. They have plenty of space outside but the downstairs is completely empty. They need to give each party some privacy.

The Cheesecake Factory is consistently the best restaurant I have ever patronized. The only reason I do not give this and other locations 5 stars is because of the fact that you have to pay to park on they&#39;re lots.

We are locals. We ordered eggs Benedict and The English muffin was black and burned and the taste of the food was affected. We Took a bottle of champagne with us and pay the corkage fee of $10 when we called the waiter and he called the manager he apologized but did not offer anything not even to cover the champagne corkage. We are not going back way. Black English muffins on eggs Benedict and just an apology really?

The salad that I got was surprisingly really good. The pizza was a bit salty but it was still good. The service was not really good though. We spent more time waiting to get out food/the bill and the dessert than we did while eating. The waitress completely forgot about us. I would love to go back because the food was good, but based on the service I got, It sort of put me off from returning to the restaurant. I would perhaps go to a different Cheesecake Factory.
Went here for the Fourth of July..wait was long but service was great, especially our server Eman. Nice view of fireworks too!

Terrible location run by a bunch of crybabies. I came here with my girlfriend to celebrate getting my new car, and it was a disaster. My girlfriend&#39;s meal came out 30 minutes before mine, and she was finished eating by the time mine came out. Then when my food finally did come out, i told the waitress that i didn&#39;t want the meal if it wasn&#39;t going to be comped, and she yelled at me for interrupting her (which i didn&#39;t) and turned around and walked away with my meal. Then the manager came out and started defending her, and when I asked for the whole meal to be comped because of what a bad experience and waste of time it was he said i was &#34;asking for too much&#34; and that i was &#34;killing him&#34;. Needless to say, I will not be back.

What a disappointed night out.  Came here on Sunday night out. ..place wasn&#39;t as busy as normally is...yet we decided to stay by the bar...it was a total mistake. The server took forever to come and even take drinks...Once again very few tables. We have seeing him taking care of another table that ordered a bottle of wine and he totally was all over them. Finally he came to take care of us...we ordered after 25 mins waiting. ..we were hungry and thirsty of course.  Then he came back to said they didn&#39;t have only favorite thing I normally order! What the hell...be nice a least and learned to be caring to your work! I am a local and it gets me upset to know they changed this people so often that they don&#39;t care.

Myron who takes the call-in orders is precise and quick! Several times ordering to-go at this location and each time my order has been wrong, so I&#39;m thankful that they have someone like Myron who has now taken over the reins! Nothing worse than getting home and seeing that your order is  completely wrong so now with Myron I have had no worries :))

Went there for my wedding rehearsal dinner and the service and food was excellent.  We had about 40 people in our party and everyone was pleased.  The staff did and excellent job and the food and drinks were delicious.  So much cheesecake!  I never thought I would have too much cheesecake, but that&#39;s a great problem to have.  Excellent event and environment for a very special occasion.

This is our favorite place in summer time. We always spend some tome on the beach and this place next to the beach is great addition to complete your evening and make your evening even better. My favorite delicious dish is tuna salad. Kids also enjoy this place and when they are here they are always in good mood. Excellent customer service!!!

Let me preface this review by saying that I don&#39;t like The Cheesecake Factory, and we only went because we had a $50 gift card and two gift cards for a free slice of cheesecake each.  It turned out at the end of the night that we only had $17 left on the gift card, and the free cheesecakes expired in 2012.  Oops.<br><br>The food is good.  It&#39;s not splendid, and I can&#39;t imagine it&#39;s healthy, but it&#39;s good.  The bread is delicious.  The service was good.  I just felt terrible at the end of the night that I was spending $80 (plus tip) on fairly plain food, and then walked outside to pay $4.50 (plus tip) in a mandatory valet lot.<br><br>We ordered a lot of food (thinking at the time that we had a lot of free money to spend. Oops.).  Here&#39;s what we had:<br>- Ahi tuna tartare (pretty good, but pretty small for $6.95)<br>- Chicken and mushroom lettuce wraps (nothing special, and as with all lettuce wrap dishes ever, too much lettuce, not enough filling)<br>- Steak salad (probably has a better name, but that&#39;s what it is - should have guessed that it would be swimming in dressing)<br>- Lemon garlic shrimp (the shrimp were big, but the best thing my wife can say is &#34;there was nothing wrong with it&#34;, which means that she can make it better)<br>- Farfalle with chicken and roasted garlic (the best dish of the night - quite tasty, but still probably fairly unhealthy)<br>- Kahlua cheesecake (I&#39;ve never seen it offered anywhere else, so it&#39;s definitely unique, but I&#39;d love to have more flavor)<br>- White chocolate raspberry cheesecake (they didn&#39;t have the chocolate raspberry, which was literally the only thing we were looking forward to - this one is an ok back-up, but just ok)<br><br>So yeah, it&#39;s a lot of food.  Don&#39;t worry, we didn&#39;t eat it all in one sitting.  But in my mind, despite the good service, and the ok food, it&#39;s way too expensive for just ok food, especially in the food mecca that is Los Angeles.  And please, please, if valet is mandatory, don&#39;t make it $4.50.<br><br>If you want better food, nicer ambiance, free parking, and to still have marina views, I&#39;d suggest Sapori on the other side of the marina.

My last experience was HORRIBLE. It started when I got a delinquent notice for parking ticket. Apparently the Valet staff parked my car in unauthorized place and I got a ticket for $63 in the mail ... huh, expensive for an OK restaurant, on the top of that I paid $5 to them to park my car, get the ticket and then dump the original. Very nice experience! For sure I am not going back to a place that force me to valet my car to a company that its staff are not responsible! <br><br>***************STAY AWAY FROM THEM!*****************

Haven&#39;t been in years but boy have they renovated their outside lower patio! Went on a nice sunny day and had drinks with appetizers, the ambiance and weather coupled with the cocktails! What more could you ask for??? I will def return, looks like the night life is great too, heat lamps and fire pits with comfy couches, oh yeah

Just like any other cheesecake. But with a few cool things. Like an ocean view terrace. Perfect for a sunset dinner. They are quick to sit you and the staff is freindly. One of my favorite cheesecake factories in LA.

After reading all the reviews for this place and factoring in my general feel for TCF based on past experiences and my bias against chains in general, I was pleasantly surprised. Sure, valet parking sucks, but I found parking for a weekday lunch just two blocks away and sauntered over. Sitting out on the patio overlooking a somewhat surreal vision of a beach... a few blocks from the Pacific, we ordered from a patient, upbeat server. Soon, she brought our meals--my friend&#39;s Pasta Da Vinci (basically a version of Marsala, 2.5-3 stars) and my Santa Fe Chicken Salad (4 stars, even if not the traditional flavor I have come to expect from places like Bread and Porridge in Santa Monica). We followed up with what the Factory does best--cheesecake. Now, my piece seemed significantly smaller than my friends, but it was still a little bit of heaven in its seasonal pumpkiny goodness. But, OMG, I had a bite of her chocolate one--I think the Godiva--and it was AMAZING. I&#39;d go back just for that... sitting on the surreal beach. <br><br>Bottom line: Sometimes chains don&#39;t suck as much as you think. Try the salad. Get the chocolate cheesecake. And, then run 6 miles. :)

My wife and I have gone to this location for years . My wife loves the Godiva Chocolate Cheesecake there, We go for Sunday brunch. The last time we went , the country potatoes were way over cooked and not eatable. I did a followup with corp. I was contacted by Greg , the manager there. He apologized for the situation. Greg made a bad situation right and took care of the customer in the end  and we will be going back.

Ehh.<br><br>Pros:<br>Food was good, waiters are nice.<br><br>Cons:<br>WAIT TIME.. waited 1 hour!<br>and valet parking is a must.<br><br>I would still go here, but I don&#39;t think I would enjoy it.<br>Nor would my wallet.
A BIG shout-out to our server Mike Smith. Absolute perfection!! Thank you. Wish this ENTIRE establishment was more like you.
Favorite place on earth! Good food, awesome cheesecake :), and THIS location is the best one ever.

Worst service ever!!! Good food however the  bend waiting to pay my bill for 45 mins if not longer . Unbelievable!! On top of everything they can&#39;t except any gift cards or credit cards  system went down...still waiting to pay my bill ..got here at 6:40 now 9 pm .. try to speak to the manager walked right past me spoke with another manager he was unhelpful all he could say is I&#39;m sorry.....

Do not come on the weekends! The service sucks! The food is undercooked and beware of the first bite of your popcorn shrimp that was fried with a piece of the plastic bag it came in. Ugh! Management get it together por favor.
This is my favorite location! On the Marina. So romantic at sunset although it can be loud at times ;) be sure to get reservations on the railing ;)

The waiters were very friendly and helpful. The place itself not too bad.<br><br>The reason for 2 stars - the poor quality of food for too much money.<br><br>To name one example: I dont understand how a restaurant can charge $19 (not incl tax or tip) for some farm raised salmon coming with conventional grown veggies. I feel robbed.<br>And there is not one organic option on the menu.<br>We left without eating...<br>Not our kind of place.

Great food but unorganized serving meal missed my brothers mayo he had to wait to get it. I ordered stake to be added to my salad not very much stake. Missed giving us our cheese on our pasta. Price was right for four people. Great singing yes singing for my wife s birthday.

This cheese cake factory is in a great location in Marina Del Rey.  Beautiful views and very scenic.  The only down fall is there is no public or street parking, so you must valet and it is so busy there is always a very very long wait.

It is all about the patio, a perfect spot to have a chill lunch.  CCF always has an expansive menu, so it is hard not to find something you will love.  I am hooked on the Thai Chicken Lettuce Wraps.  I also think their brown bread is the bomb.
Good food nice big portions very special unique dishes friendly stuff .... Great location

Waited 2 hours to be seated but it&#39;s Mother&#39;s Day and it was expected. We were finally seated at the dreadful corner table #76  and it was terrible. It was a four person table which they made for five. One of the chairs was in the aisle. We requested to speak to the manager and she reseated us even during such a chaotic day. A Huge thanks to manager Jennifer for making sure we were happy. We (5) were fully accommodated and the food was served astonishingly quick. Our server Aaron was awesome and very attentive. Thanks!

I went to dinner with my wife. After we ordered the food, i specified that i wanted angel hair pasta instead of regular pasta. The food came with regular pasta. After telling the waitress , she took it back to bring the correct one. It took them 15-20 minutes to come back with the correct order, when my wife was already done eating. I just had two bites and didn&#39;t enjoy my dinner at all since my wife was sitting and waiting for me. After all the manager just offered a free cheesecake instead of complimentary dinner , which would have been correct for an upscaled restaurant!

Favorite cheesecake location hands down.  The view is just breathtaking, especially during the sunset. Brought my date here, and just as expected, she loved it.<br>I got my usual smoke house bbq burger and she got a shrimp with angel hair. Her shrimp pasta was ok, little dry for me but she enjoyed it. Service was pretty good considering how packed it was on a Saturday night.   We ended the night with something oreo cheesecake, which melted in my mouth. Go try that cheesecake guys. you won&#39;t regret it.<br>Overall, good service, good food, good beer and wine, good desert, good view, and good company.   =]    minus 1 star for the valet.. little too pricey, but it is in marina del rey...

I see many people posting about the mediocre food. Get over it people. It is Cheesecake Factory. It&#39;s a glorified TGIFs... and a small step up from Olive Garden... but also everyone knows this when going there. My food was decent and the service was great. I had a member of my party have too much spice on his steak. Our server, Lindsey, was very accommodating in having the kitchen re-cook one and having the sauce on the side.<br><br>Great service, Lindsey...<br>Good food, Cheesecake Factory...<br><br>PS - I hate the fact that I &#34;have&#34; to valet my car. I can park in your parking lot by myself.
Great atmosphere good vibes over looking the boats n water great food and great service

the food here is so-so. It&#39;s a bit pricy and falls into the realm of mediocre tastes expected with most chain restaurants. I did receive excellent service though and one highlight is their home-made ranch dressing made daily. Best ranch I&#39;ve ever had but my buffalo strips were just ok.

Long wait even though there were plenty open tables.  Food? MEH, SLOW service.  Conserving electricity, are we? so dark, couldn&#39;t see what I was eating.   Valet $6+TIP why? parking lot is right there.
Amazing service . Always checkin you out if you need anything. Good prices, good food. Aaamaazzing cheescakes

We came here on Mother&#39;s Day and had such a lovely time thanks to our sweet waitress, Nicolette. She was so attentive and friendly. Couldn&#39;t have asked for a better waitress on that special day. Thanks Nicolette for making my first mothers day a great experience. That tiramisu cheesecake you recommended was delicious!  Definitely coming back here again!  :)

I visited the Cheesecake Factory this past Saturday for a friends birthday. We waited for about 2 hours. We had a large party of 15. When I followed up to see when we would be seated, the manager told me he spoke to Dee (the person whose name the party was under) and told her that it would be a long wait. In return, I simply asked if they could check. Then he said, the table is finished, we just can&#39;t tell them to leave yet. I told him I understood and we can wait. We were called to our table in the next 20 minutes. It took about 30 minutes for us to get bread to our table. After one of my friends was waiting for another 30 minutes, she decided to cancel her burger, the assistant manager told her no because the burger was cooked already. Then she proceeded to go on about homelessness. She told my friend she had to pay although, she tried to cancel ahead of time. Then she sent the waitress to say the same thing. I&#39;ve always been able to return or cancel food. Our waitress was not very attentive to our table. I just feel like the service was sub-par​ that day. I&#39;ve had better experiences but I was disappointed.

Their salads are never the healthy options. Go ahead, order it. You&#39;ll see what I mean.<br><br>But you don&#39;t go to Cheesecake to eat healthy stuff. You go to indulge *HEART<br><br>White Chocolate Caramel Macadamia Nut Cheesecake was BOMB! If you like the sweet stuff like I do (and it&#39;s realllyyyy sweet) then this is a great pick!<br><br>Oh, and their patio was really nicely toasty! LOVED that. I hate being cold and was worried about having to stick it out out on the patio (because we had a large group that didn&#39;t want to wait longer for inside seating). But no worries! All their heaters are gona keep you warm :)

Beware!! For having such a great location, this is the worst Cheesecake Factory I have went to. I came here with my family a little over a week ago. We waited about 25 mins just for a server to come and get our drink order. After 25 mins the server came and said they were between shifts and he would come back to get our order.  We were a party of 7. We all order a dish and my bother-in-law got the chicken parmesan. HE GOT FOOD POISONING!!  After a few hours, he was throwing up non-stop. I called the the restaurant to let them know. After waiting a while on the phone to talk to the manager, she told me no one ever gets sick from their food and he probably has the stomach flu. I was surprised that the manager is also a doctor at Cheesecake. Impressive! She was rude and said she would follow-up with me. She NEVER did. I wanted to write this review before I contact corporate with my complaint.

I had a gift certificate to come eat here and I was putting it off because I just wasn&#39;t that excited to go... But I was so happily surprised! Food was really good. Service was top notch and sitting outside on the patio watching a sunset was such a great way to unwind. Since it&#39;s so good, it&#39;s pretty popular though so long wait and no reservations on weekends.

This is the best location by far. The view is incredible and you can play on the beach while you are waiting for a table. Also, the tables outside are lovely and there is a beautiful view. Service is on point. Food is always perfect. We always go for the avocado eggrolls to start. One of my favorites is the jambalaya pasta which is spicy and so good!

One of my favorite restaurant ever. I just love to go there use their patio to watch the sunset while eating the most delicious food ever. I love that place and I always go there for any of my special events. Great service, servers, and managers. Can&#39;t wait to go back

Whenever I come to The Cheesecake Factory, I usually leave happy due to their good service and good food - WITH ONE EXCEPTION.<br><br>Recently, I went to The Cheesecake Factory with five other people. Our waitress was named Patricia K. It seemed like she was annoyed with us the whole time she was serving us. She probably didn&#39;t make any effort because of the automatic 18 percent gratuity. <br><br>She asked if I wanted her to pack my food to go, except I couldn&#39;t answer because I was still in the middle of eating when she rudely took my plate away without even waiting for my response.<br><br>I wish I could have gone to the manager and asked for an adjustment on the tip because she certainly did not deserve 20 bucks.

It&#39;s Cheesecake Factory not STK, so you have to know the difference before you come here! But for what Cheesecake Factory is and stands for, it was a very pleasant experience! Our waiter tonight was Steve, awesome guy! Made our dinner very pleasant and fun. His recommendations were on point and his attitude was extremely welcoming and sweet. Thank you

Long wait to get a table and service. Weekends are packed especially with out of towners. Not surprised. They have one of the nicest view of the Marina. That&#39;s about the most pleasant part of my experience eating here. Waited about 40 min for a table and 20 minutes to order food. Wow that&#39;s already an hour!  Food is so so. They definitely have some good cheesecake though. Banana cream is delicious! Only valet parking at this restaurant.

Cheesecake Factory is one of my favorite chain restaurants, because i like everything i&#39;ve tried from their menu.  I also like the ambiance and beach view.  Plus it&#39;s close by me. :)<br><br>I&#39;ve tried a few items from the menu, but my all time favorite is the &#34;Miso Salmon&#34; and this review is for that.  I love seafood and i normally get fried shrimp or crab legs when i go have seafood at restaurants known for their seafood.  Of course Cheesecake Factory doesn&#39;t sell crab legs. :(  So therefore I decided to try the Miso Salmon here on a visit a while back and i&#39;m now addicted to it....and can&#39;t seem to bring myself to move on to something else on the menu.  The miso glaze gives the salmon a nice semi-sweet taste, but definitely not over bearing.  I would actually recommend this dish to anyone who wants to give seafood a try, and not worry about it tasting fishy.<br><br>Oh....and if you like Carrot cake, you have to try it here.  Other than the Palm restaurant, i would rate their Carrot cake as my favorite. <br><br>My least favorite thing about this location is the tight parking spots the valet guys have to fit your car into.
Love the friendly staff here. Really make me feel good when I come in, and when I get takeout. You can since the &#34;smile&#34; over the phone:)<br><br>Great food too!

I ALMOST got to eat at The Cheesecake Factory in Marina Del Rey this evening, until I found out I would have to pay to park in your own parking lot (valet parking only--we could park ourselves but would still have to pay the same fee). Not Cool. We decided to dine somewhere that we didn&#39;t feel like they were trying to squeeze an extra five bucks out of each group to pass through their door.<br><br>Having eaten at other locations, I know that the food is exceptional, and was looking forward to a nice dining experience, but it was not going to happen this time. I am baffled as to why there was about forty people waiting outside to be seated, when they already had to pay to get in to the parking lot.

THIS PLACE IS GROSS. READ THIS. THEY MADE 2 BIG MISTAKES WITH MY ORDER!!!!!!!! Wish I can give them a zero.<br><br>Food: I ordered the chicken lettuce wraps. Im allergic to peanuts so I said no peanuts on anything.<br><br>BIG MISTAKE #1: They had peanuts sprinkled all over my plate and it took them another 20 minutes to get my correct order. Eh happened before but I was not happy.<br><br>Drink: I ordered white wine. What I got was not white wine.<br><br>BIG MISTAKE #2: YOU WILL LOVE THIS!!!  The server brought this fingerprinted wine glass with something that looks a little muddier than white wine. I asked the waiter what it was and he swears that its white wine.  He obviously does not know what he&#39;s talking about.  I brought the glass to the bar and asked the bartender WHAT IS THIS! He looked to the corner of the bar and said &#34;Sh*t, thats the cup of left over drinks at dinner tables used as a measure to show how much wine we should pour. Your waiter must have grabbed it by mistake.&#34;

I love the Cheesecake Factory but NOT this location. I came into town for business but won&#39;t make an effort to come here again. I was seated rather quickly but where I was sitting there was gum underneath the table that got all over my slacks !!  my waiter took forever to bring out bread and a busser came out with my drink and my appetizer. The waiter saw that I had gum all over my pants and saw me trying to get it out and told me he was going to get his manager she took a while to get there and was so insincere about it telling me she will pay for the dry cleaning but I told her I was out of town and she just said sorry and walked away... the waiter came back and was a lot more sincere in his apology I ended up getting buffalo blasts which were extremely greasy I ended up eating two of them and asked for my check because I was so upset.

This Cheesecake Factory experience was so poor and disappointing that I don&#39;t think I will ever come back to this location. Especially after trying to give a friendly feedback to Quinn, the manager on duty. However, instead of hearing out what I had to say he just mentioned that they get an &#34;A&#34; rating and they are fine... It won&#39;t be too long for either Quinn to be fired or this location to be shut down. Too bad!

I like the Cheese Cake Factory, and this location is very nice with the outdoor seating and gorgeous view of the Marina. Their drinks are GOOD! I had the Bikini Martini and my oh my, it was tasty ;) The food is also good and prepared relatively fast. Of course I have to mention the cheesecake *Banana creme is delicious* <br>I&#39;m so lucky to live literally 5 minutes away from this place, I&#39;ll come back all the time ;)

Being a organictarian most of the time, I don&#39;t eat here that often and I haven&#39;t tried any of the dishes that contain meat, but I love the artichoke, both the skinny and the regular one, the side asparagus (which I ask to be made soft, not crunchy) &amp; the skinny Belgian Endive salad with goat cheese (instead of blue cheese). The view is lovely outside, overlooking the Marina and the servers are almost all super-friendly and attentive. I like coming here. I prefer to pay for parking in the public lot just North of the restaurant. Especially since valley parking is a bit on the pricey side and I like the walk along the beach to the restaurant.

Dinner was amazing last night. Our waiter made the evening comfortable and funny. His name was Duan (sorry if I misspelled it). I will definitely go back. He was super attentive. Plus the wait for our table was shorten than what the hostess told us.

First time eating at The Cheesecake Factory.  Yummy food, large portions and beautiful view of the boats in the water.  I didn&#39;t even get to the cheesecake I was so full =(  Loved the valet parking and the staff were very friendly!
My first time ever!! This location is beautiful service was friendly food....Aaaamazing!

LOCATION: Love it! Right on the beach.  Outside seating is so nice (if you end up on a couch seating facing the beach).  Shady and beautiful.<br>GLAMBURGER - OLD FASHIONED HAMBURGER:  Had lunch and wanted a nice burger.  Tasted great - but it is exactly what the name says - ol&#39; fashioned burger.  <br>PINA COLADA:  Totally hit the spot!<br><br>DOWNSIDE: Very disappointed that the women&#39;s bathroom did not have a changing table for babies.  I had to walk around to find a spot on the beach to change my daughter&#39;s diaper.  There&#39;s obviously plenty of room in the big bathroom, so not sure why they don&#39;t have it installed.  What&#39;s ironic is the restaurant is right across from the children&#39;s playground!!

Defiantly wont be going to this Cheesecake Factory again. <br><br>Parking/Valet: Their lot is so small and there are always lines to get it. Wait time to get a spot can vary up to 2 hours! The valet staff can be a little reckless when driving/parking cars. <br><br>Restrooms: Are disgusting! There are puddles on the floor or at the very least a quarter inch of water on the floor, along with some toilet paper and other miscellaneous things. <br><br>Food: The portions are really big so one plate will feed 2-4 people. I don&#39;t know if I would try anything off the menu, its just not the tastiest food. Note: The menu is a book with way too many options and at least 5 pages. The cheesecake is delicious!<br><br>Manager: Rude and very disorganized.<br><br>Overall: I don&#39;t plan on coming back to this location and would only do pick up service for the cheesecake.

This review is based on their waiting system. We checked in at 5:30pm and they said it would be an hour wait. An hour and 10 minutes later, I checked in to see how much longer it would be, and they said they had assigned us a table and the people at that table hadn&#39;t finished yet and they couldn&#39;t tell us how much longer. An hour and 45 minutes later, we still hadn&#39;t been called, and the host gave us the same spiel, and said there was nothing they could do because they had assigned us a table. People who came after us were able to be seated before us because of this protocol. Ridiculous! We left, and I will never go back to this location.

Asked if we could have the summer rolls without cilantro since my husband doesn&#39;t like the taste, was told they&#39;re premade - fair enough! Ordered something else but when my husband&#39;s plate arrived everything was full of cilantro (it wasn&#39;t mentioned as being an ingredient on the menu which is also fair enough, but since the server knew he didn&#39;t want it, he should have acted accordingly.) Sent it back and it took so long to be replaced that I was done eating by the time his plate arrived. Kinda ruined the meal for us. No apology was forthcoming.

I visited the one in Marina Del Rey a few weeks ago. The food was great but the ladies room was unkempt. I advised management who seem not to care because after an hour it still was not clean. Guess I won&#39;t be visiting this location again. So I posted this review on their Facebook page and received a message from &#34;The Cheesecake Factory&#34; requesting my contact information so they could &#34;follow up with me.&#34; I submitted the information via their contact form and &#34;someone&#34; was going to be contacting me. To date, I have not heard anything. I believe that was done to &#34;save face&#34; on Facebook. I will not be visiting this or any other location anytime soon.

We have been here in July 2012.<br>We really like the Cheesecake Factory and the one in San Francisco was great.<br><br>But this one here was a bit disappointing. Not the food, the service.<br><br>The food was great, as always. But the service was so rude!<br>One of us was still eating the main course and she started to ask us for dessert.<br>We told her that we will wait until all are done with the food. 2 minutes later she started again and was telling us which great cheesecakes they have today. My girlfriend was still not ready yet with her food and was really pissed. We told the service that we still wanna wait for her. We all needed a little break because of all the food.<br>2 minutes later she asked us again. <br><br>That is really annoying. If we tell you to wait, so wait, dammit! We told her that we were really disappointed and she started to be rude and told us to order dessert or to pay.<br>So we paid. Fuck off! Was really a great birthday for my girlfriend... Not!

I really wanted to give them no stars but that is not possible I waited one hour to be seated when they said 20 minutes then the host said they had been calling my name when the buzzer didn&#39;t even buzz she should have just called me a liar great costumer service obviously isn&#39;t a requirement to work here then we were seated I waited one more hour for our food and my steak is over cooked and they forgot my sides the waitress didn&#39;t come to our table at all I had to call a near waiter by the end of my experience I&#39;m just over it I know it&#39;s not a steak place but seriously it was really bad service no apology from the host no apology from the waitress the manager came to the table but at this point I just wanted to leave but I didn&#39;t want to ruin the rest of my parties time never going back I&#39;ve been here so many times sometimes I just went for the cheesecake but they don&#39;t care for long time costumers.

So It&#39;s a Saturday at 130. and My friend and I decided to come to the Cheesecake Factory. when we get here the wait is reasonable 20-30 mins and it&#39;s nice. the waiter is good the hostess are good. that&#39;s where the two stars comes in. but I need to say that we sat down at about 2pm and didn&#39;t get our food for 50 mins!! a family of 4 sat down and finished before we got our food. AND when we did get our food our steaks were entirely too well done and the food was COLD?! seriously I had to send it back and get it re done. never will I come back to this Cheesecake Factory again.

Tonight&#39;s date offered me the choice of Cheesecake Factory or 3rd St. Promenade. The outside patio, recently remodeled warranted a visit. <br><br>We sat outside on the lower patio where there were fire pits and tiki torches. The ambience was romantic. We conversed with the reflective view of the water, kept warm by the patio heaters and enjoyed the nice summer evening.<br><br>He ordered a pear martini which he said was &#34;potent&#34;. Multiple times he offered me a drink or two.  I declined and had an appetizer plus grilled shishoto peppers. It came with a dipping sauce, perhaps it was ponzu? In the past shishoto peppers at Japanese restaurants before have lit my mouth on fire. For some reason, these were so mild, I could barely detect any spice at all which was unusual. <br><br>We mutually parted ways. Not one to valet park, I was relieved to find that my parking was free. I had entered on Panay Way near the Marina Fitness sign on the building. The gate was up when I came in, the meter was not lit up, appeared to be out of order and no one in attendance. Not sure what&#39;s happened to the City Of L.A.&#39;s parking lots in MDR, however it worked to my benefit tonight.

Food was good, and the outdoor seating is nice too. I&#39;ve eaten in and had takeout, since I live down the street, both times the food was ready fairly quickly.<br><br>It can get really busy here, and they pack the tables in tight. Sit outside for a bit more personal space.<br><br>$5 unavoidable valet parking

So the Cheapskate Factory responds to my review about my Mom&#39;s 90th birthday experience and asks me to contact them so they can speak to me directly about our experience.  Being the fair minded guy that I am, I actually honor their request.  And, of course, they never call me back.  I guess I should have told the Cheapskate Factory to call me collect...

I&#39;m a big fan of cheesecake factory because they have so many different options but this place really sucked. The food was horrible. So we ordered a burrito which came with no guacamole and when we asked the server she said umm were out of guacamole... Then the fries who can mess up fries? They were cold and soggy. I ordered the bbq chicken salad which they brought out and it was missing the onion rings on top my favorite part. They waiter said i&#39;m going to bring your inion rings soon. So after 15 min of no onion rings i go to the bathroom on my way back I saw the waiter grab some onion rings with his bare hands from a bigger plate of rings and take it to our table... Is that even sanitary? I think not. If this wasn&#39;t bad enough my mom ordered the luau salad. The waitress came and said um sorry we dont have the wontons that go in this salad so we said its fine since all the rest of the food was out.. Later the manager came and said that he was making them fry fresh wontons and the salad wouldn&#39;t be charged. Overall it was a horrible experience. My hubby got a club sandwich (im sure your wondering how that could&#39;ve been messed up right?) the bread was burned. I honestly don&#39;t know if it was an off day but to mess up all 4 meals seems a little weird to me..

Their avocado egg rolls are a must!!! This location is best for a Sunday brunch or a birthday dinner over the weekend, just be sure to make reservations before hand because it does get a bit crowded due to the view.
Had no wait time on a friday evening for party of 2. The window seats are nice for something to look at. Get alot of food for the price.

Good<br>- Wait staff is usually pretty nice.<br>- Some nice views of the water.<br>- Pineapple upside down cheesecake is good.<br>- Breakfast is served all day long.<br><br>Bad<br>- Expensive prices for mediocre food.<br>- Parking lot is valet only ($4.50 for dinner).<br>- Huge menu with like 200 items.<br>- There&#39;s ALWAYS a wait. If you have a large party, good luck.<br><br>I honestly don&#39;t know why people love this place so much.....

Great view and it&#39;s consistent food as a chain. Outside they have way too many heaters so unless you are really freezing sit inside in the winter or spring because it is warmer outside.  Service is usually pretty bad as we always see be waiters and the hostesses are usually snappy and rude. They should be used to high volumes of people not happy about 45 minute waits for okay food.

marina del Ray , 1 block away from the Marriott <br><br>-goat cheese beet appetizer- 9<br>-buffalo chicken tenders- 9- yummy weird mix with bufolo dipping sauce<br>-dynamite shrimp-7 not like of changs. dipping sauce not marinated.

I love cheesecake factory and this review is solely on the service at this location. The food taste good but service was not good. Our server came to introduce himself and didn&#39;t even bother asking us if we wanted something to drink. He wasn&#39;t even the one who brought out our food. Nor did he ever come check to see if we needed anything else, no drink refills even had to ask for our bill..never asked us if we wanted cheesecake or dessert either. So we paid and ordered cheesecake to go and the guy that helped us there wasn&#39;t nice either. I truly expected better service at cheesecake factory.

This is my favorite Cheesecake Factory in Los Angeles. The staff are usally friendly, and the happy hour is always nice. The Valet attendants always try to pressure you into valet parking (Valet and self parking is the same price). But I usually self park, so I don&#39;t have to tip.<br><br>Service is always nice. Only once have I been there, and the service and food was bad.

Has great beach side seating.. be ready to pay 4.50 valet for dinner time. However, one of the better Cheesecake Factory&#39;s around. Sits right next to the Marina, and if you are lucky you can really enjoy it on a nice summer afternoon. Service was excellent. We had the Bellagio Pesto Pasta.. our first time trying that dish out and we walked out happy! We also had the Avocado Rolls.. can never go wrong with those.

I am giving this place one star solely due to the valet and I believe the restaurant should do something about them! <br><br>I went here last night on a date with my boyfriend and, as usual, we had to valet. I have no problem using a valet and I think it is quite convenient. The valet at the Cheesecake Factory in Manhattan Beach is much more pleasant BTW. After dinner, we both realized we did not have cash. The valet does not take credit cards... this is one of my problems. It is 2013 and accommodating for credit cards is not far-fetched at all. Also, if this is the case, the restaurant should at least have an ATM on hand. However, the valet does not take credit cards and there is no ATM on site. Here is where the valet worker started with his attitude. We simply asked what the option is when people have no cash and he starts yelling about there being an ATM across the street at a liquor store. <br>After a bit of back and forth trying to figure out where this store was (it was next door around the restaurant), my boyfriend started walking over to the store. I handed over my ticket and after a few seconds I found a $5 bill in my purse. So I figured he would bring the car before the boyfriend would make it to the store anyway and I could pay him and leave. I am waiting alone in the cold at night in a shirt with no sleeves. The man goes over to where the keys are kept and I figure he&#39;s getting the car. All this time passes by and still... no car. Even if I was waiting for him to return with cash, they could have brought the car over for me to sit in to the side as I have seen them do before. I ask one of the other attendants where my car is and he just says &#34;I don&#39;t know&#34; quickly and now takes another two sets of keys from a man that walked out of the restaurant. Their cars come. Mine is still not here. The boyfriend comes back from the store and asks where is the car? I still don&#39;t know either. I walk over to them and before I even say anything, the initial man yells &#34;I am getting it!&#34; This was so rude and disrespectful. In my attempt to keep my cool, I just shrug it off and say &#34;well your tip is gone.&#34; My car was finally brought out and now I have to wait behind these other two cars with people who also don&#39;t have cash. So I am there for a longer period of time as my car is blocked on both sides.<br><br>We had such an enjoyable experience in the restaurant with a WONDERFUL waiter and great food. It&#39;s unfortunate that the valet is quite the opposite.<br><br>I will not be returning to this restaurant because of the valet!
Great food!  Great view! Our waiter Iman was the sweetest!  Thanks for the amazing service.

Worse worse worse restaurant experience first of all my family n I spent about 15 mins watching the waiters go back and forth without anyone approaching us or our table to assist us! This place is horrible the manager had a huge shit face and was not welcoming at all! This place is too busy with no one that knows how to handle their  job last time going

The location clearly means a wait.  We arrived were told an hour.  Okay.  We&#39;ve been warned.  As we approach an hour, I inquire to our status.  Answer:  we are ready and will buzz your pager right now.  Another half an hour passes and I go back up.  The hostess has  an attitude and says sorry we should have never told you the table was ready.  We wait another 20 minutes.  I go back up.  Clearly she is overwhelmed.  There is no manager around.  The seating is out of control. <br>Finally we get seated.  Again we wait for a waiter to come by and start our dining experience.  Finally we get a waiter.  He says hi and disappears for another 10-15 minutes.  Comes back for drink orders.  We get half.  I have to ask another waiter to accommodate.  This cycle continues through the whole meal.<br>Orders messed up, half the food coming out.  We all wait while the other half show up.  <br>What adds insult to injury is an overall attitude like &#34;hey look around, we are so busy and have such a great location that we don&#39;t really care whether you look to come back.&#34;<br>This is not my first visit to this location.  It will take a lot to not be my last.<br>Be careful about planning anything special that involves this restaurant.  Disappointment is just around the corner!

A group of 10 of us went to this location after a memorial service for someone who had committed suicide.  It was an emotional day for all, but we were good sports about waiting 1 hour with a pager for our table.  After the hour, we asked if a table would be available soon and were told it would be another half hour.  45 minutes later we asked again and were told it would be another HOUR.  We waited nearly 2 hours for our table, with a very tired 4 year old in our midst, and got nothing but attitude, anger and annoyance from the hostesses and manager when we asked how much longer the wait would be.  When we told them we were leaving because we were tired and starving, they basically said they couldn&#39;t possibly care less, and shrugged their shoulders.  To top it off, we still had to pay $4.50 for the valet.  <br><br>I will never, ever eat at the Cheesecake Factory again.  Their policy of not taking reservations is rude and demeaning, and I&#39;m going to tell my friends to boycott them as well.

Really Long wait. Rude Staff.<br>Ive had better food on an Airplane<br>Waited an hour and  45 minutes to be sat, about 20minutes to have someone take my order. 30 minutes for food to come out. it was cold. Got my drinks after my food. Everything was terrible. Complained to the Manager who did nothing, he didnt seem to care at all.<br>He was more of a jerk than the waitress.<br>Ill never come here again.<br>Oh and did I mention... they dont take reservations?<br>???
Good quality wasn&#39;t that great. It had a nice view but the food wasn&#39;t really appealing. Their chicken tasted frozen and didn&#39;t have texture. The vie was amazing though

Eat on the patio or drink cocktails by the fire-pit overlooking the marina.<br><br>-It&#39;s like you&#39;re in the South of France!!<br><br>Great outdoor atmosphere and lighting, huge menu and friendly staff.<br><br>Surprisingly romantic (patio) - this cheesecake Factory is a WINNER!!!

5 stars for the waiter he was great! I came and visit this location with my family for my little cousin birthday on 11/15/15. Of course it was slow to get a table but it worth for a 4 star restaurant . What I have a problem with there bugs on the table where forks and spoons are on. I have newborn what if the bugs crawl on him we tell the manager she said sorry that&#39;s it who doesn&#39;t want to do nothing. So I have to pay for food I don&#39;t even want to eat! I didn&#39;t get no offer to come back or I&#39;m sorry food on us please come back. I spend too much money! I have been another location who the manager treat me great because they was hair in my food. I go home and throw food away have to clean my baby bag out we even got video the roach crawling nasty!!! I contact the company I hadn&#39;t even got a call that&#39;s bad taste in my mouth. I travel far to eat there when I could of went to new location in Cerritos !  Make sure your table is clean I would ask for new folks I hope I didn&#39;t eat any bugs eggs
came here last night wow great view nice staff ...

Feeling good? Satisfy your cravings(and not savings) here! Not only you get BOMBASTIC(yes its an actual word) food but also atmosphere for the perfect intimate setting(even if you are single and have no hope you will find it here ;)). I get the Factory Burrito and for dessert Chocolate Tower Truffle Cake. Get ready to pull out $20 dollar bills because you ain&#39;t going home with them :D

New Menu!!<br><br>Just today they started offering this &#39;skinnylicious&#39; menu. It has a bunch of small plates, salads and entrees that are from the regular menu, but have some things missing from them that give the dish too much fat, calories or salt. I have the pear and endive chicken salad and it tasted the same as the regular one. I asked the difference and the waiter kindly replied that the dressing was a new recipe.<br><br>My friend had the Asian chicken salad and the dressing was also a new recipe, but where most of the calories left were in the Wonton crispies. They are not included in the &#39;skinnylicious&#39; menu option. If you can stay away from eating the free bread, slice of cheesecake and only order from this new menu, you can easily be on a diet and have a lunch with the girls at Cheesecake Factory and not feel guilty.

Food is reasonably priced for the portion size, and really tasty. Double espresso was not worth the order - stick to regular coffee for your caffeine fix. Mojito cocktail was one of the best I&#39;ve tried but came at a price! Service was good and the vibe is great for a casual night out.

Picked up a friend for dinner who recently moved to the area to be closer to his work at LAX. Upon arrival, we were forced to valet park, $4.50 charge. The attendant said self park or valet, you still have to pay the fee. Ripoff. <br><br>The dining room was a little crowded so, we decided to self seat in the bar area. Our server arrived promptly to take our drink order and asked about an appetizer before we even opened our menus. I love quick service but, we felt rushed. <br><br>We passed on a appetizer because my bud is doing the whole P90X thing so, he&#39;s watching his food intake. We ordered our entrees and they arrived quickly. Before we even took our first bite, the server was there like flies on dung, asking how everything turned out. I really didn&#39;t have an answer for her, being that my fork was still wrapped in my napkin. I had the orange chicken with brown rice. The chicken alone was delicious. The rice was dry, I had to ask for soy sauce to rehydrate it. Which was a task to get because the server walked passed us about 4 times before I finally grabbed her eye. My bud had the turkey and avocado sandwich, not a crumb was left on his plate so, I&#39;m assuming he liked it. Our server didn&#39;t hover, which I appreciate but, after she dropped the check, she was never seen again. I had to walk up to the bar top to have her run our payments. So our experience was meh. Nothing to write home about. With the $4.50+ tip parking charge, I will probably visit other Cheesecake Factory locations that have self parking.

Super friendly, quick staff! I live right near by and whenever I go, just me, I can be in and out in 30 min, regardless of how busy (assuming you&#39;re willing to eat at the bar). Definitely recommend.

Had dinner with family, prior to an international flight at LAX. Made Jizelle our waitress aware of our pending flight.  Wow!  Quick service.  Also had  told manager that were celebrating 2 birthdays.  She  brought a dessert glass each with a birthday song.  Out in 45 minutes.<br><br>Going to LAX, I was surprised how close it was. GPS bypass the freeway and got us to LAX in no time.

I am very dissatisfied with the service me and my group of friends experienced on our visit. Me and 3 friends went to lunch on Saturday, 6/23/12. Our waiter, Mika, was very kind and pleasant, however, he was also a bit forgetful. He took his break, and introduced our new server, Matt. The only problem is that Matt only took our order for drinks, not our food. We ended up waiting for Mika to come back from his 30 min break to order our food. THEN, as we watch other tables, who arrived after we did, get their food before we did, the food finally arrives another 30 mins later.<br> <br>The food was great, with the exception of one of my girlfriends. She ordered salad and chicken wings...the problem was that the chicken wings were still RAW in the middle. We asked for the manager, and a gentleman came to our table. I did not get his name unfortunately, but he attempted to tell her that it was a blood vessel that popped during their &#34;double cooking&#34; process.<br> <br>As a mom, and a cook, you know that the blood would be burgundy if the blood vessel popped during the frying, not RED! Thank goodness, he took it off the bill, but we were dissatisfied all together that instead of accepting responsibility, he made it seem as if the chicken was supposed to be that way. <br><br>The friend who recomended that we visit this establishment, said that she had pristine service before, so we were all baffled at the mistreatment we received on our visit.<br> <br>On the plus side, the scenery  and location is breathtaking, but I regret my visit and would not recommend ANYONE to visit this restaurant....if you expect great service.

Nice people, fun location, boring but decent food. Here is my problem: the drinks are the weakest you&#39;ve ever had except for at a luau in hawaii. I got a blackberry martini that tasted like juice. I sent it back and they charged for an extra shot. Altogether it was about $18 for that drink. No thanks.<br><br>I&#39;m updating this a year later by adding a star. Waiters are very nice. I&#39;m ordering beer now.

I usually avoid this location on weekends but was seated right away on a Tuesday night. The food was adequate and my Mojito was quite good. I gave four stars because our server was excellent.  That combined with the view makes it four stars for sure.

I absolutely love this place. Everytime we go here the staff are extremely friendly and attentive. I wish I could eat here all the time. Plus the patio seating is right on the beach, can&#39;t get a better view!

Just tried to put in a carry out order, was put on hold 5 minutes the first time, then again for 4, if I wanted to wait that long I would come in and sit down. I just moved next door and get carry out often. Good job cheesecake, my first and now only attempt to order here.

I usually only go to CF when I&#39;m invited (aka, it has never been my first choice.) I&#39;ve been to ones back home (NY) but this one was different - the view. The food is not much to boast about. I usually get a salad (chicken on the side) and eat the nice bread. There&#39;s only valet parking. Make sure you know which turn to take to get to the restaurant or you&#39;ll be stuck in the Venice Beach traffic.
By far my favorite location to dine!  The food is as good as ever, and the best part is the romantic dining option on the outdoor balcony.
Guest services responded to my complaint and sent a $35 gift card to make up for the bad experience. In my mind, the right thing to do. Wish all companies handled this like this.

The service here is a hit or miss. The waiters/waitresses seem to not really care for customer service 100% other than the general greetings. This place has become more of a production line of food than a place to go on an special occasion. Food is not bad but we were waiting 20 minutes for our food after appetizers, to the point we were ready to jet out. Used to love Cheesecake Factory but now it&#39;s more like an iHop now.

I have eaten at The Cheesecake Factory for many years and for the most part my experiences are usually pretty good. Well it just so happens that there was an issue this particular visit with our order and we had to speak with a manager. When I tell you that great customer service goes a long way!! The manager Chris made everything that went wrong absolutely right... We ended up sorta happy we had a problem in the 1st place just because we got to meet the most nicest manager anyone could ever meet! Thanks again Chris you are so awesome!

I went to this location on my first night in Los Angeles. A friend took me to Marina del Rey Cheesecake Factory because of the view. I found the waitstaff to be friendly, but the place was a bit crowded. The view of the marina was charming, with that sweet California weather. It&#39;s nice for a glass of wine and a light meal. They also have a variety of hearty dishes for the hungrier folks. Cheesecake was... Awesome.

I&#39;m a big fan Cheesecake factory but I recently ordered the Spicy Cashew Chicken.  It&#39;s a stir fry dish served over rice.  Absolutely terrible.  It was just chicken fried with way way too much hoisin sauce.  To top things off, the rice wasn&#39;t cooked all the way through.   I should have sent it back, but I didn&#39;t want to embarrass the group I was with.  At least the service was excellent.  Don&#39;t order the Spicy Cashew Chicken.

Live in the area and frequent this restaurant . Usually get the Bbq chicken salad and dressing on the side . Last night had the ahi tartar for the first time . Got deathly sick worst stomach pains and couldn&#39;t move . Don&#39;t think it was fresh ! Will never get that again . Called the manager and didn&#39;t even offer to try and compensate . Disappointed !

I&#39;ve ordered from here for delivery about a dozen times.  The food here is just not very good compared to other cheesecake factory branches.  Fish is overcooked and dry.  Pasta is undercooked.  Rice is super dry.  They randomly decide to not give you any side dishes.  Would not recommend going to this one.

Can&#39;t comment of the taste or quality of the food, there&#39;s wasn&#39;t anything I could eat there due to my strict diet. But I can definitely tell you, you&#39;ll get your money&#39;s worth as far as the proportions go. The plates and the amount of food is massive.

It was worth to try this place once, but I don&#39;t think I will go back there again. Tables were so close to each other that my wife and I felt uncomfortable. The waitress was very nice and prompt. The parking was big and I did not like to give my car to the valet to pay $5. The food was good.

I&#39;ve been to cheeseake factory a million times, both here at home in Chicago and travelling elsewhere. So when my co-workers and I found ourselves in California, looking for something quick and easy for dinner- something we could rely on being good- no surprises- we chose Cheesecake Factory. FAIL!<br><br>The issue was service! <br><br>No one ordered anything strange. One girl got an individual pizza, one got chicken tacos, I got fish tacos and someone had a salad. Nothing too complex.<br><br>When the food was ready, the server brought 2 plates out to our table and then walked away. Now, me (fish tacos) and my friend (chicken tacos) sat waiting for our food. <br><br>And we sat. And waited. And waited. And waited. And waited. <br><br>Now lucky for our server we were all chatting and gabbing and enjoying one another&#39;s company. However when a good 10 minutes had passed and still no food, we started to get a tad cranky. <br><br>Someone (a manager of some sort?) stopped by our table to inqure as to what we were waiting on. We told him an order of chicken tacos, and an order of fish tacos. He said he&#39;d go get our food for us- even looked in the direction of the kitchen and told us our food was ready and he saw the server getting it now.  LIAR. <br><br>Another 5 mintues later the server brought our food. If you are keeping track, it&#39;s been 15 minutes since our friends got their entrees. They were pretty much finishing up their meals. The server apologized and he said he&#39;d go grab the manager. The manager came by and apologized. That&#39;s it. <br><br>When we all ordered a slice of cheesecake for dessert and got the bill we were SHOCKED that they didn&#39;t do anything to make up for their error. There was no free slice of cheesecake, no measley $5 gift card for our troubles, not even a discount on the bill. Nothing. We still tipped the waiter well- it wasn&#39;t his fault. But the fact that they think that is acceptable is really telling. <br><br>I will never return to any cheesecake factory again. The place is so over- priced, especially for a crappy chain restaurant. And for such trashy service, any moron could figure out how to remedy the situation. Maybe that&#39;s why they work at Cheesecake factory. It probably didn&#39;t help their cause that the 4 of us are in sales and would never treat a customer that way.

favorites:<br><br>ask for all brown bread and skip the white<br><br>sweet corn tamale cakes, avocado egg rolls, spinach and cheese dip apps<br><br>fettucine with sundried tomatoes (i lose the chicken)<br><br>RED VELVET CHEESECAKE and HOT CHOCOLATE<br><br>one can never go wrong at the cheesecake factory. the marina del rey location is beautiful and the staff are wonderful. it can get crazy busy so either go early or get your order to go.

Been going here for over 25 years and the service and food keeps getting worse and worse. My fiance and I went the other day and we had 4 different servers waiting on us, the smell at the table was horrific, we had a hair on my fiance&#39;s food, they forgot our sodas about 4 times, my salad was made wrong... i could go on and on. I even worked here for 5 years, back in 1993 and it was so much better back then. I live down the street and love to be able to walk here and love the views and outside seating, however the food and service has gone so downhill. When we complained to the manger he offered us cheesecake, after telling him my allergy to Dairy, he insisted still on giving me cheesecake....really? Unbelievable.... needless to say we were very disappointed with the service and disgusted by the food after finding that hair.

The warner center and grove location both have better tasting food and menu IMO.<br>But, pussy-whipped into bringing in-laws here.<br>Orders:<br>Nacho appetizer=gigantic, but not enough salsa, or even close. If they paid a bit more attention to this dish it would be great. Chips are crisp and hot, cheese could be better distributed across nachos.<br><br>Chicken Bellagio=ridiculous amounts of sodium. Basil pasta underneath so salty that youre better off skipping that part, heavy salty buttery cream sauce. If I was 1/2 my age no prob, but hard to digest for a 37 year old.
