Chicken lightly breaded and tasted good. They put 2 slices of prosciutto, I&#39;ll eat that with anything! And top it with aragula, kinda gets owned by the cream sauce and heat of the plate.<br><br>Fried shrimp and fries=you order this your asking for it, wivey had it and it vas very &#34;Gordon&#39;s fish&#34; like. Cole slaw was gross and tasted raw/unwashed/like dirt/you get da picture.<br><br>Pizzas=decent, good cheese, toppings, crust. <br><br>Service=changed 3 servers by the time we decided on a right table, but good overall.<br><br>Very ho-hum place. You eat one meal here at 1pm and you dont need to worry about food before, during, or after, anytime until you wake up the next morning with garlic dragon breath, no matter how many times you brush/rinse/floss.<br><br>Benihana, which isnt at all gourmet food these days, still abetter option IMO, but no view.

This has got to be the most overrated restaurant in L.A. I&#39;ve been here only once and it was for a work event. In other words, I had no say in the matter.<br><br>When I arrived, I was a little shocked to see a red &#34;C&#34; displayed in the front window. To some, a red &#34;C&#34; means it&#39;s still OK to eat there. To me, it means &#34;We don&#39;t give a shit.&#34; In any case, like I said, I had no say in the matter.<br><br>And what&#39;s with those menus? I&#39;m an old fashioned guy.  I think that if you&#39;re going to charge so much money for mediocre food, you should be able to provide a menu that doesn&#39;t have advertising in it. Lose the ads, Cheesecake Factory. It&#39;s tacky.<br><br>That said, they do give you a lot of food here. More food than I would care to consume in one sitting. But that&#39;s what makes it such a good value, right? Uh, no. It&#39;s still overpriced. And definitely not worth waiting over an hour for.<br><br>The Cheesecake Factory sucks.

I made a vow, a few years ago about the Cheesecake Factory restaurant chain. I&#39;ll never actively go to one of these restaurants to eat a meal, I don&#39;t give a fuck if I&#39;m starving. <br><br>Living in Pasadena, I&#39;m used to seeing the one located in Old Town, and the lemmings actually waiting 45 minutes to be seated. F-That. <br><br>Let&#39;s not get it twisted, either. 4 stars for the cakes. <br><br>I mentioned before, in my Jerry&#39;s Deli review&#34; that their cheesecake rules. Well, so does the Marina&#39;s (Cheesecake Factory) location. We went at night, and if you&#39;re not careful walking on the pier, it can look (or feel) like you&#39;re about to fall into the water. I was probably drunk, so that may have had something to do with. <br><br>It was crowded, but we ordered in advance, and took our cheesecake slices to go. I did notice, if you get a good enough seat, you&#39;ll sit right next to the water. Neat. <br><br>That&#39;s all I got.

Food was decent but horrendously overpriced. We were placed underneath an air vent blowing freezing air the entire time. The waiter came by the table only once outside of taking our order and giving us the check. I was not given a refill the entire two hours we spent waiting for our food. The restaurant forgot part if our order but since the waiter was absent for the entire duration of our meal, there was nobody to tell about this. When the check finally rolled around, we were able to tell the waiter that they forgot part of our meal. He tried to weasel out of it and say that he could bring it back out to us, but by that time we were all finished eating and had no desire to stay any longer in the frigid conditions that we were placed in. He refused to remove the part that he forgot from the check and had to call his manager, whom which offered a measly piece of cheesecake as compensation. When we got the piece of cheesecake it was visually tampered with (i.e. somebody licked it), but by this time we just decided to cut our losses and leave that place.

My girlfriend works at the Cheesecake Factory, which puts me in a position that I feel I can help explain a lot of the weird or annoying things that can go on there<br><br>The valet:<br>Yes, it is &#34;forced&#34; valet, but only in the sense that you have to pay. If you want to park your car yourself all you have to do is insist that you park your own car. Just make sure you hand your keys to the valet before you go inside. Big deal right?And the reason the valet is required to charge you to park your car even if you do it yourself or if it isn&#39;t busy is because the lots that the valet uses are owned by the city. The city charges not only you, but also the valet company and the staff of the CCF to park there. It sucks but that&#39;s just how it is.<br><br>The crowd:<br>According to my girlfriend, the busiest times are weekends, weeknights after 6 or 7 PM, anytime during summer, and holidays. <br>Their reservation times are kind of weird (only certain times for certain days of the week), but if you have a large party of say, 10 or more, they say it&#39;s best to send a couple people from your party before the rest of your party arrives, so that they can get you guys on the list without everyone having to wait. Worst comes to worst, if the wait is too long, you can always order food to go.My girlfriend is a cashier and she tells me that the usual quote time for to-go orders is 15-20 minutes (which is a hell of a lot faster than waiting 1 hr + just to be seated!). And when you order to-go, you still get a great view.There is a playground and seats on the beach you can take your food down to that is much more secluded than the seats inside the restaurant.<br><br>The seating arrangement:<br>We all agree that the seats are really close together and can get kind of annoying.On certain nights when the restaurant isn&#39;t too crazy busy (like if it&#39;s night time and everyone wants to sit inside because they&#39;re cold) you might be pleasantly surprised to find that the patio is usually warmer than the dining room. They keep the heaters all over the patio cranked up to eleven. <br><br>Also, about whole cheesecake orders:<br>Order your cheesecake at least 2 hours in advance if you want it to be ready to eat by the time you stop by to pick it up.They keep their whole cheesecakes in a freezer until someone orders one, so if you walk in expecting to get a 10&#34; Godiva Chocolate Cheesecake all ready to serve in five minutes, don&#39;t hold your breath.<br><br>And as for the sometimes sub-par service:<br>I know by the time you actually sit down and are ready to order you probably had to deal with all kinds of things(a line for the valet, a line to get in the door, waiting for your pager to buzz, etc.),but try to keep in mind that while you are experiencing all of this crazyness, so is the staff, and they have to keep it together while balancing all of their orders and special requests, tracking down a manager, and being stopped for something by someone every time they walk by.  (The CCF is known as a hard restaurant to work at because of the stress involved.) Now of course that does NOT excuse poor service.You went out because you wanted to have an experience and it may not matter to you what the staff may be going through. In this case, just remember that you ARE having an experience, so enjoy it. You&#39;ve got great food, a great view, and some great company. If you rush the experience you went out for, what was the point? Let&#39;s say you&#39;re waiting to be seated and it&#39;s going to be a while. You can talk to the person/people you came with, look at the cheesecakes, even ask the bakers for some recommendations.The point is to relax and enjoy the entire experience and look at the glass half full.<br><br>So that being said, my girlfriend and I have made a list of some of our favorite items and also popular items:<br><br>APPETIZERS:<br>Spicy Ahi Tempura Rolls<br>Avocado Egg Rolls<br>Buffalo Strips<br>Tex Mex Egg Rolls<br>Sweet Corn Tamale Cakes<br>Thai Lettuce Wraps<br><br>ENTREES:<br>Miso Salmon<br>Louisiana Chicken Pasta<br>Cajun Jambalaya Pasta<br>Chicken Madeira<br>Chicken Bellagio<br>Pasta Da Vinci<br><br>APPETIZER AND ENTREE SALADS:<br>Ceasar Salad<br>Chinese Chicken Salad<br>BBQ Ranch Chicken Salad<br>Seared Tuna Tataki Salad<br><br>DESSERTS:<br>Original Cheesecake<br>Adams Peanut Butter Cup Fudge Ripple Cheesecake<br>Tiramisu Cheesecake<br>Stephanie&#39;s Ultimate Red Velvet Cake Cheesecake<br>Keylime Cheesecake<br>White Chocolate Raspberry Truffle Cheesecake<br>Lemoncello Cream Torte<br>Dulce de Leche Cheesecake<br>Linda&#39;s Fudge Cake<br>Strawberry Shortcake<br><br>One final note: Don&#39;t go to the CCF if you&#39;re on a diet. They&#39;re known for large portions, sweet drinks, and CHEESECAKE. None of which compute to LOW CALORIE COUNT. Also the calories listed on the cheesecakes are per slice. For example if the calories were per cake, you would divide the cheesecake calories(the Red Velvet cheesecake for instance-1,556)by 12 slices and that comes to about 129 calories per slice - in your dreams! You wouldn&#39;t believe how many people can&#39;t do the math.<br><br>Thx 4 reading!

I get that everywhere in LA, you&#39;re paying for parking, or getting a ticket for parking no matter where you go.  I get that.  However, it&#39;s freakin&#39; Cheesecake Factory!   Ummmm, hello, all other Cheesecake Factory&#39;s...parking is free.  Uuuuugh, but because it&#39;s in the marina...and because every other snooty place in the marina has valet...so must the Cheesecake Factory.  Booo!   <br><br>To me, the Cheesecake Factory isn&#39;t fancy, like all the other places around it.  I&#39;m not impressed.  However, my guilty pleasure is their cream of chicken something soup.   That...and the brown bread.  YUM!   <br><br>Alright alright...and like all others have mentioned...the breathtaking view of the marina from the window.  *sigh*  It&#39;s pretty freakin&#39; nice.

How could a Cheesecake Factory be only a 2 stars??!! I&#39;ve been here a few times and every time I decide to give this location another try, I get disappointed... on the CUSTOMER SERVICE!! <br>I&#39;ve even done a third party Mystery Secret Shopping/dinning at this location before for corporate @ this location always sends assignments out, because I&#39;m sure reviews from the Mystery diners are not that great either! <br>I&#39;m not too thrilled on this location to begin with. The Location is hard to locate and even a GPS gets confused.. lol <br>It&#39;s a smaller Cheesecake restaurant, But it seems like the setting of the restaurant just didn&#39;t seem right. The Kitchen is in the front left side of the restaurant and located between the entrance of the restaurant between a very small and tight pathway and the hostess table where customers checks in. People walking and stopping in between this short walkway bumping heads and feet. <br>The Kitchen&#39;s counter top is where the chefs put the plates of food out for the waiters to serve. It is on a low level, reachable counter. With customers and employees walking in and out, I can just imagine the dusts and germs flying all over the food. When we were walking out of the restaurant, I witnessed this guy sneezing. Didn&#39;t cover his mouth and a plate of salad is left there on the counter where his saliva probably flew into the salad. :-( GROSS!! <br><br>Here goes our journey.. <br>Pulled into the parking lot and parked by the the cleaners. The valet guy comes over and screamed, That&#39;s pay parking! I said excuse me sir? he said, &#34;Paid Parkin, I said.&#34; <br>I gave him the $3.50 he asked for and he didn&#39;t give me a ticket. I asked for a ticket and he said no need. How the heck do you charge me for Valet parking and don&#39;t put a ticket on my car. What if another valet driver don&#39;t see the ticket and get my car towed??? There was another car that pulled in. Obviously he had a complaint too because We were both waiting on the Manager to come talk to us. <br>We spoke to the manager and she apologized behalf of the valet service and just explained that each location and city has their own parking policies. Fine, I respected that. So then she went out right away to tell the Valet service guy!! .. Uh, wait a minute, should I leave, what if they do damaged to my car out of anger.. sigh... <br><br>(You see, the Redound Beach location where I go to most of the time has a small parking spaces for handicap parkings, take outs and a few limited regular parking spots for people who doesn&#39;t want to pay for valet parking. Marina Del Rey has those parking spots too, but they choose to charge their customers for the parking. ) <br><br>While being served, Our server wasn&#39;t too thrilled about the fact we wanted refills on their bread. Well, sometimes, I go there for their delicious bread, but not like we didn&#39;t order any main dishes. We did!! <br>The water with lemon the waiter served us, 2 out of 5 cups tasted funny.. There was a goat cheese like after taste in my water!! My Mother said the same thing about her cup of water. We called the waiter and nicely asked him if he can exchange the water for us. I even showed him the greasy residue that was left on our cups. He said sure and walked off like we bothered him. NO Sorry?.. NO, explanations?.. NO excuse us for not washing our cups clean enough!! We were NOT difficult customers and even try not to bother him too much. He wasn&#39;t as friendly as I expected it to be, because I have high expectations of friendliness customer service from them. Well consider me spoiled by the other Cheesecake Factory locations. If something like this would happened, a manager would of showed up at our table with the waiter and apologized behalf of their business. <br><br>What do you expect when you go to Cheesecake Factory?? Great food and Beyond Great friendly Customer service, because that is what they are known for and that is what I usually get when I go to their other locations. <br><br>Sadly to say, I will never return to this location again... EVER!

The cheesecake factory rocks!!! So far every plate I`ve tried is delicious. Especially the chicken and shirmp bang bang. Not to mention the dulce de leche cheesecake and their fresh made from scratch lemonade. Will definiely return for a night out, no doubt.

Easy to love, especially on a sunny Friday afternoon in March. Came here for lunch two weeks in a row and sat out on the patio. The service was excellent, the atmosphere was tranquil, and the food was delicious. I had some flatbread and a skinnylicious Asian Chicken Salad and my beau&#39;s mom had the Herb Crusted Salmon Salad. Yum! It ain&#39;t cheap, but the portions are large and the ingredients are of high quality.<br><br>I&#39;ve eaten here on many occasions and definitely recommend it!

This is the Cheesecake Factory with the best view in LA. What&#39;s better than enjoying a nice dinner outside with a marina view? The food is standard Cheesecake Factory. Service is good and fast. <br><br>The only downside (and why I&#39;m subtracting one star) is the valet. I hate valet because we have to pay. My husband hates valet because he hates anybody else touching his car. However there&#39;s no way out of valet since there&#39;s nowhere else to park. So 4 stars for you, Cheesecake!
Great place.  Love the CF anyway and this location did not disappoint.  Sat at the bar and had drinks/food and it was awesome.  Bar staff was super friendly.  Just a great night out

Cheesecake factory is hype on the food, but most definitively not on the cheesecake <br><br>Snicker cheesecake puts you in a coma, a good coma...<br><br>the staff here is always helpfull and ready to make our dinners enjoyable...when tryin new items i ask for honest opinions and they have yet to send me down a path i regret...<br><br>honestly, one of the most humblest CCF ive ever been too...

Went here for lunch, knowing full well I should have kept driving down the street to Cafe Del Rey...but did I listen to myself? No, of course not. <br><br>First off, valet is $3.50---miss me with that.<br><br>Secondly, I gave this place another chance, even though I always have bad luck all of there locations. I ordered from the bar, and I should have known cuz dude had no idea what I was talkin about. All I asked for was a lunch size Cobb Salad, I didn&#39;t want it tossed (for some reason they like to toss their Cobb salads which is just stupid anyway), and dressing on the side. Not too difficult? <br><br>Obviously it was, because minutes later he came back and asked if I wanted dressing on 1 half and the other half dry???? WTF was he talking about? I just want dressing on the side.<br><br>So, he comes back with my food. <br>1. The salad was tossed.<br>2. He brought me 2!!!!<br><br>I had to walk out on that one. Cuz he blew my mind. It&#39;s not that difficult. A Cobb Salad with dressing on the side...easy. I ended up leaving and going to Cafe Del Rey where I always have a nice time.<br><br>PS...I had a flash back of why I knew I needed to request that the salad need not be tossed. I ordered one before and it was horrid, ice berg lettuce, not mixed greens like the menu says, the chicken is damn near raw and un-seasoned. They mix everything together, even the dressing, it looks like someone mixed the salad, ate it, and they transferred it to semi clean plate. <br><br>If you haven&#39;t picked up on it yet, I F&#39;ing hate this place with a passion.

SIt outside!!  This is one of my favorite Cheesecake factory.  Even though this is a chain rest.  I love this place. The outside dining is perfect, the wait can be long on the weekends.  My favorites here are the Shrimp Bistro pasta, The belagio chicken and the sweet corn tamales...  Of course all the cheeesecakes,and the tiirmisu too!

On vacation from Houston, TX and decided to hit up Cheesecake Factory. My son, wanted steak so we ordered the Hibachi Steak. Waitress was great, drinks and appetizers came out in a reasonable amount of time. <br>My daughter and I both had the Cajun Pasta, good, but a little more oil pooled at the bottom for our taste but I scooped it out.  We&#39;re on vacay so the patience meter is extended a little more than the norm. My son, who was the hungriest of us all had to wait on his dinner for about 10 minutes longer. His order was supposed to be everything minus mushrooms and  sub fries for mashed potatoes. What came out was hibachi jerky, VERY dry with sauce on the side laid on top of sprouts and mushrooms, no asparagus and the requested fries never came. Didn&#39;t see the waitress for about 7 minutes after the food came so I could let her know we were missing 60% of the order and that it wasn&#39;t prepared as requested. She finally brought the fries 15 minutes after the plate was given and my son had started eating on the beef jerky because he was HUNGRY after a full day at the beach. <br>She said she would  get the manager to come over when I asked for the vegetable that never came (did I mention I never requested a manager). When he finally showed up (to a table that was packing and leaving and I had to wave him over to us) his response was (insert sarcastic laughter) &#34; whoa looks like he ate it, couldn&#39;t have been that dry&#34;! I hadn&#39;t even explained yet what happened. I started to tell him that we had been waiting so long he started to eat the ancient meat and the fries had just arrived but he interrupted me and asked my son what his favorite cake was. In true kid fashion he said chocolate so the manager was like &#34;ok I&#39;ll send chocolate cake&#34; AND WALKED AWAY! No apologies, and didn&#39;t even take into consideration that this kid is still hungry! WTF! I never asked for a refund and he didn&#39;t even offer to remake it! All I wanted was for my son to actually eat dinner! So, after paying the bill, I went to Subway to feed him because he was still hungry. Oh yeah, the manager never gave me his name otherwise I would use it here. I&#39;ll just call him the tall fair skin Jerk, which is fitting because my son was served $18 beef jerky with no sides. Thanks Marina Del Rey Cheesecake Factory for the impeccable service and consideration. Subway did the job and we actually got what we wanted for way cheaper. Oh and by the way, the chocolate cake sucked too.

Ok, I have literary visited this restaurant at least 15 times since high school. I obviously came back for a reason. For a chain restaurant the food is good and they have large portions. At this particular location summer evening dining is awesome. Yes, yes, yes there are many pretty faces as well. Anyway, my point being I was a fan of this location.<br>That was until my last 2 dining experiences. <br><br>Anyone who knows me knows I&#39;m very laid-back, easy-going and friendly. For whatever reason, my last two times at CF our waitresses treated us like scum. It was like they were disappointed to deal with my table. What? We all looked happy, affluent and easy to approach. But noooooo. Each time, the two different waitresses were rude and would not acknowledge us. I hate to do it and never had to but damn do I have to throw out the &#34;Race Card?&#34; Was it because both times my group was Hispanic and Black? I have never experienced that &#34;feeling&#34; in all my travels around the globe. Needless to say, I reported my experience (both times) to management and walked out before ordering. Twice. I gave this place a chance and I experienced the same problem. <br><br>That said I hope that negative vibe is gone and if you go, may you have a better experience.<br><br>Food: Good, large portions, wide variety<br>Eye Candy: Excellent<br>Parking: SUCKS<br>Wait for table: SUCKS<br>Service: SUCKS BALLS<br>Management: SUCKS

This location is AMAZING!! We went for a kid-free date night and I couldn&#39;t have asked for better. It was busy but we only ended up waiting 20 minutes for an outdoor table and we got to walk on the sand while we waited. We were seated on the top deck right on the edge with an amazing view of the marina!! They had the patio heaters on which felt amazing, the waitress we had was great, food was amazing, and lights and ambiance was phenomenal. Very romantic dinner at our favorite restaurants. Don&#39;t think I would ever want to go to a different location after visiting this one. The only thing I could say about this restaurant is that they put the tables a little too close together which is annoying because you end up having to listen to the entire conversation of the table next to you. We actually requested to move from our original table because the people next to us were talking very loudly and in a foreign language and it was beyond bugging me but the restaurant moved us without issue and we got a much better table.

Why does everyone give this restaurant such a bad rap?  Granted, they shouldn&#39;t put ads in their menu, and there is usually a long line of hungry tourists ahead of you, but you do get good-sized portions of a variety of  tasty food for a fair price.    <br><br>I went with a friend for lunch today and - surprisingly - had no wait at all.  It was another gorgeous day in paradise, so we were seated on the patio.  I hadn&#39;t been here for some time, but  I already knew what I wanted.  You know how when you find something you love, you just can&#39;t wait to get back and order it again??  Well, that&#39;s how I feel about the Fried Chicken Salad that CCF *used* to have.  Bummer.  <br><br>After perusing their extensive new menu,  I selected the Barbecued Ranch Chicken Salad and I enjoyed it, but it didn&#39;t compare to the salad I planned to eat.  <br><br>Two other favorites:  Avocado Egg rolls and Thai Lettuce Wraps.  I sometimes order either one of these as an entree.  Outstanding!!  <br><br>Marina del Rey location has a great view of Mother&#39;s Beach and they&#39;ve recently replaced all of their patio glass window panes dividing the restaurant from the beach.  Much nicer!  You can actually see through the panes now.  The old Plexiglas panes were so scratched and dull that it was unattractive.<br><br>Of course, their desserts are famous, delicious and decadent.  I don&#39;t usually indulge in the sweets after dinner.  No room...their meals fill me up.  <br><br>You must valet park, unless you have a friend who lives in the neighborhood.  Lucky me...I just walk there.  :)

First off this place was a train reck. The parking lot is your worst nightmare. On top if your lucky to get valet to take you, you have about 30 people PLUS waiting outside the restaurant which makes you feel it&#39;s much harder to breath in. The wait time was 40 minutes to an hour for a table! lol Luckily my girlfriend and I ordered over the phone as I was heading over there from Covina, California I was out on hold for literally 20 min before they took my order! I understand it&#39;s busy and I do not hold that against them but I would have at least liked to have been told I was gonna be on hold for more that 15 minutes. Long story short, the place is just to crowded and full of people that make it look like a dmv waiting in line. I wouldn&#39;t recommend this location only cause of all that chaos. Other than that the host and staff were nice and friendly even though I&#39;m sure she was stressed out from all the people waiting.

I took my guest to this restaurant , we were seated right away! It took the waiter at least 10 minutes to get to our table. I ordered avocado rolls for our appetizer and 2 drinks.<br>After 7 minutes he came back with the drinks and we ordered our main dish, mine was garlic noodles and I specifically told the waiter NO OIL and NO Butter ! then he left.<br>We waited at least for 30 minutes and no appetizer and no food!!! I called the waiter and asked about the appetizer and he goes OMG ! he had forgotten to put in the order for avocado rolls !!! so he ran back to the kitchen and came back telling us we had to wait 7 minutes more! I was upset and embarrassed in front of my guest. that was the first problem, the second problem is that they bring my garlic noodle and there is oil and butter dripping from it and there was a Ton of oil at the bottom of the pasta dish!!!<br>I called the waiter and told him I had ordered NO OIL so he calls the manager who&#39;s name was Mark, he comes and tries to convince me that the oil is not oil and its chicken broth like I am stupid!!!<br>I said this is oil and you must change it so he takes the food and comes back in 2 minutes and tells me that they took out the oil but it was still so so oily , I told him I wasn&#39;t stupid and asked him to make a new one without oil. so with an angry tone of voice he goes : OK.<br>He comes back after 10 minutes with a new dish, anyhow we waisted a lot of time there and it was so upsetting. finally the waiter brings the bill and tells me they took care of my dish and I won&#39;t have to pay! so I look at the bill and see that my dish is charged twice and taken out once !!!!!!!! ?????<br>They really think everyone is dumb ! I called the waiter and he goes oh sorry let me tell the manager so he leaves and comes back in 5 minutes telling me that they didn&#39;t charge me for the new one but I have to play for one! I was so furious and my guest was so upset that I said lat me just pay and get the hell out of this horrible place.<br>Their food is so expensive and you still don&#39;t get what you order and you still have to pay. Cheesecake Factory marina del rey is a horrible place and I don&#39;t recommend it to anybody.

It&#39;s always crowded, but the food is good..They have improved the seating , which has helped...went there recently when I was down for in LA.  And yes, is it over hyped, of course, but the food is still good.<br><br>If you are going to go, make sure that you are ready for a wait...and just don&#39;t stress about it...you don&#39;t come here for fast food, you come here to people watch and to be watched..no really, you come for some decent tasty food that they duplicate at all of their restaurants....<br><br>Enjoy...and nothing beats plain cheese cake with whip cream....i know, I&#39;m simple.

It pains me to write this review. My husband and I had our first date here 16 years ago and try to get back every year or so on that anniversary. We&#39;ve always loved the food, although every time we go they&#39;ve removed another item we like from the menu. There is now only one item left of our favorites. Because there always such a long wait for a table, we arrived mid-afternoon, hoping they would be less crouded. It was. We walked right in, only to find the hostess station un-manned. We waited a few minutes but no one showed up. We looked to the bakery immediately behind us hoping to ask for help there, but it was un-manned as well. After about 10 minutes someone showed up and we were seated. As the hostess sat us down, she explained that we might have a longer than normal wait, as the waitress was busy. I looked around the dining room and realized that all the patrons were seated together in one section. This made me wonder if they were short staffed. A great way to start our anniversary meal.<br><br>Service was indeed slow. While ordering, I asked about one dish - herb encrusted salmon. Our waitress described it to me and I ordered it. When it came, it was far from the menu description or what the server told me. I didn&#39;t want to make my husband wait so I didn&#39;t send it back, but it was disappointing. Then, with our cheesecake, I wanted a cappachino. I asked our server if it was strong or whether I should add a shot of espresso to make it that way. She assured me it was very strong and only Italian men needed the extra shot. The coffee arrived so weak it looked like a few spoonfuls of coffee added to a glass of milk. Worse, it was barely lukewarm. I tried to get her attention before she walked away, but could not. It took quite awhile to get the attention of ANY server. We waited quite awhile for the replacement coffee, which wasn&#39;t much better. I didn&#39;t send it back, because we were waiting to eat our dessert. Even though they knew I was unhappy with the coffee twice, they did not offer to take it off our bill. <br><br>They have some good items on the menu, but the poor service just isn&#39;t worth it any more.<br><br>As we got it the car, my husband looked to me and said, &#34;I guess we&#39;ll have to find another place to celebrate this anniversary starting next year.&#34;

Why are there so many haters on this Cheesecake Factory?<br><br>I remember when this one opened nearly 10 years ago, when I lived on Manchester. (Remember the doughnut shop?!) <br><br>The food/drinks/happyhour: excellent. <br>You can stroll out after dinner/drinks with a friend....haha<br><br>Valet parking is mandatory, but $5 inc. tip is cheap. <br><br>Strange situation:<br><br>Friend pulls up her 2010 Lexus GS350 to valet, about 2 hours later, we pick up the car, and valet says there&#39;s no power steering. <br><br>?<br><br>Very strange, no one is implying anything, but it happened.<br><br>Just sayen&#39;.

I suppose you can call me somewhat of a Cheesecake Factory connoisseur. I have been coming here for years and I love it! It was actually my new year&#39;s resolution one year to try every single cheesecake they had and what do you know, it was the only new year&#39;s resolution I have ever kept! My favorite cheesecake, white chocolate caramel latte, was actually gotten rid of, so my new favorites are pumpkin pecan, red velvet, or the tuxedo. You really can&#39;t go wrong with any cheesecake though, or any of their other cakes. (I love the Chocolate Truffle Cake the most)<br><br>The food there rarely lets me down too. I&#39;ve had most of their appetizers and my top picks are the fried macncheese balls, the avocado rolls, the spinach and cheese dip, the buffalo blasts, or the firecracker salmon rolls. Out of their pastas, I love the four-cheese pasta, the carbonara, or the farfalle with chicken and garlic. Their salads are amazing too, I usually never order salads when I go out because I never feel like its really that satisfying, but at the cheesecake factory, they are tasty enough as a meal and definitely fill me up, especially the BBQ chicken or the luau salad. Their burgers are always a solid choice too. The only things I&#39;ve gotten there that I wouldnt get again are the fish and chips, which I thought were bland, and the belgium waffle, which was just like any other belgium waffle. <br><br>Anddd of course, I can&#39;t forget about the amazing bread they start you off with! Lets just say its a struggle for me to not fill up on the bread :P<br><br>I love how the taste (and portions) of the dishes are the same at every Cheesecake factory. It never fails me. The only downside is that I&#39;m practically holding my stomach in pain and can barely stand up after a meal here. And I&#39;m probably swiping a few days off my life with all the calories i&#39;m inhaling... oh well! Its definitely worth it!!! =]

The view can&#39;t be beat. Not crazy about the valet parking. Food is standard CF fare. I would opt for the outdoor seating if available and the weather is right. Takeout option is quick and easy, but be sure to park in the To Go area.
Worst service ever!!!!! Waited 3 hours just to eat it was ridiculous I will NEVER be back !!
The place is nice, the portions are very big. Huge cake selections can be attractive to those who like cakes. While one can find some vegan options, I would not highly recommend for vegans...

I usually don&#39;t write reviews in general, especially for chain restaurants but this one impressed me. It has a nice view of the water and the food was good. We started with the tropical margarita and the avocado eggroll appetizer per waitress&#39; request. That was probably the best part of the meal. I got the herb crusted salmon which like a typical salmon dish and my date got a filet mignon (it was ok also). We ended the night with tiramisu cake (not the cheesecake) and that was really creamy and delicious. There is also a walkway from the cheesecake factory parking lot if you want to walk with your date after eating.

Do not come here if you have a big party since they don&#39;t take reservations and the wait is super long. We had a party of 8 people and waited over 75 minutes for a table. The waiter took a long time to get us bread and throughout the night, we could not get anyone to serve us drinks for quite a while. We were starving but the appetizers came after the entrees did. The pastas we were ordered were pretty bland. We came to celebrate 2 birthdays. They usually offer complimentary ice-cream sundaes to you if you have a birthday, but if you want the free sundae, DO NOT buy a cheesecake for dessert. We bought 4 cheesecakes and were not offered the sundaes because we bought the cheesecakes. However, their policy is, if you don&#39;t buy a cheesecake, then they will give you the free sundae. Very odd logic to me, since, if we had known this ahead of time, we would not have bought the cheesecakes. Customers should be rewarded for buying their cheesecakes, not for NOT buying them. When the cheesecakes arrived, we also didn&#39;t have any knives for a long time and had to use our forks to cut them. The cheesecakes were not particularly good and just tasted greasy. It was a terrible night and ruined my birthday. I would highly recommend NOT coming here.

Finally got to eat at a Cheesecake Factory. Being from Detroit, which is by far the largest metro area in America without one (even though the family that founded it is from Detroit and had a cheesecake bakery here), I had to try it.<br><br>The $28.95 Appetizer Combo was spectacular, especially if you have a party of four or more (or want to eat it with just dessert). Everything on it was delicious and quickly finished off. <br><br>They have Fresca!!! As a diet pop drinker, it is so cool when a restaurant has more than Diet Coke. Cheeseburger in Paradise is the only other chain I know of that has Fresca on tap.<br><br>The entrees were very good. I had the hibachi steak which was nicely done, with wasabi mashed potatoes and fried asparagus......<br><br>Was so stuffed, could not eat any cheesecake....Will come back again though!

Well, what can I say about the Cheesecake Factory...<br><br>Portions are very generous (enough to usually split a meal), and the food it good. Not amazing. But good. Service has also always been very decent. <br><br>But at this location, it&#39;s not really about the food - it&#39;s about the outside patio. The patio is a lovely spot to have lunch. Beautiful view of the marina, and when you&#39;re sitting outside, it doesn&#39;t feel like you are dining at a large chain restaurant. <br><br>On colder days they have heaters, and on the hotter days, they have umbrellas, so the temperature is usually pretty great. Seating is a little tight (they really use up all the space possible) so be ready to squeeze around tables.<br><br>Take your mom here for lunch and buy her one of those adult pink lemonades. Then after lunch stroll around the little beach area to walk off that huge meal you just ate. Makes for a great little Sunday afternoon.

Here&#39;s the deal with the Cheesecake Factory... this is true not just of the Marina restaurant but also the ones in Brea or Pasadena as well. There are some items on the menu that I really like! Some of my favorites are the Pasta Jambalaya, Memphis Burger, and the Chicken Madeira. With places like the Cheesecake Factory, once you find something you like I guess you keep ordering it. I&#39;m sorry but some things on the menu don&#39;t sound good at all. Like all chains they keep weeding out those items that don&#39;t sell. <br><br>Our favorite cheesecake quickly became our least favorite cheesecake once they changed the recipe. We used to order the carmel cheesecake all the time until they changed it for some reason. Now we order the red velvet cheesecake. Simply to die for. Literally to die for because it&#39;s so full of calories and other stuff that clogs arteries and cuts down on life span. We have to split it. Oh well, that&#39;s the price one has to pay if one wants to splurge a bit. <br><br>I usually find the atmosphere and the service pretty good. I will always return... just not as frequent as I used to and most always with a gift card that someone has given us.

It&#39;s the cheesiest<br>Note: worst coffee ever. Burnt tasting with a gritty texture, but then again they aren&#39;t known for their coffee.  Food was on par with other Cheesecake restaurants that I&#39;ve visited.

I&#39;m giving four stars because of our server, Ian.  Without him, it probably would&#39;ve been three.<br><br>The food here was definitely good.  I got the Mesa Chicken, which I loved, and my boyfriend got the Jamaican Black Pepper Shrimp.  The downside was that the shrimp were supposed to be fairly spicy on their own, and he asked for the chef to make it extra spicy.  It ended up coming out completely lacking ANY spice.  We let our server, Ian, know that, and he went into the kitchen and asked the chef to make a serving of the sauce extra spicy, which he brought out in a bowl for us.  That was awesome, and it made the dish perfect.  We got the artichoke as an appetizer and it was alright; the sauces that came with it, though, were phenomenal.  I would order it again just for the sauces.<br><br>All in all, I&#39;d say it was a decent dining experience.  Yeah, there&#39;s a valet there, but who cares.  It&#39;s less than five bucks.  Get over it, people.  That parking lot isn&#39;t the biggest and if you had to self-park, you&#39;d be bitching that there&#39;s no valet.<br><br>Oh, one last note: if it&#39;s warm enough out, try and sit outside, especially at night.  There is a very nice ambience with the string lights overhead and the beach right there.  There are also space heaters that make it just as warm and cozy as if you were inside.<br><br>Good stuff.

What can I say -- I love the Cheesecake Factory.  In particular, I really love the location of this one.  It&#39;s perched right on the marina, and is beautiful.  Going here for lunchtime is fantastic -- usually no wait, and plenty of outdoor seating.  Dinner time seems to be much more crowded here, with good reason -- it&#39;s a fantastic place to go.  Gotta try the peach bellinis. :-)

Long story short.. came here for graduation lunch..the Hostesses were short and rude..our waitress was spot on and gave great friendly service for a party of 25..my Daughter had the Salmon and as we were leaving became violently ill.. I mentioned it to the Manager on duty and she was nice and took my name and number to check on her.. which she did not do. After I got my car from the Valet and while my sister waited for her car another lady waiting for her car told her she got very ill after her meal and the manager comped her lunch.. she had fish as well.. Don&#39;t get fish here!

Walked from the mariott with my family for dinner. Immediately seated on the deck. There were heaters and prompt service. We shared a great appetizer and then our entrees. They were fresh and tasty. This is a great location overlooking the marina. It was a great evening. Highly recommend

Carry-out service stinks.  The food is way less well prepared than when you eat there, which is at best just a cut above mediocre anyway - with a few exceptions that are well done.  But if you order those same dishes to-go, they clearly don&#39;t put any energy into them.  They also forget to give you dressings and sauces that go along with the food.  <br><br>Dining out on the patio is redeeming, but mostly because of the location on the Marina.

We really enjoy the food and service here.  The prices are reasonable too.  Would give 5 stars if they took reservations after 6 p.m. Also, the restaurant is too dark inside, the lighting needs to be a little brighter.  During our time there last night, I observed numerous patrons using the flashlights on their cellphones in order to read the menu.

I come here a lot and so do the HOUSTON ROCKETS when they are in town..i&#39;ve seen them twice...actually I see Dikembe Mutombo often in Marina Del Rey..he must live there or something<br><br>definitely need to try the avocado egg rolls...BOOOOOOOMB...make sure to dip them in that green tangerine sauce...<br><br>their burgers are great...their fake kobe beef burger is actually great...<br><br>a friend from Mexico came out and she fell in love with this place..actually she fell in love with the cheesecake..great cheesecake and great view of the Marina..not as good as the Warehouse...but overall good

Dude, why is there valet parking.... YOU HAVE PLENTY OF PARKING. I literally knew where my car was and the parking was not packed.<br><br>I don&#39;t know about you, but I am very picky about who gets to drive my car.<br><br>Anyways...<br><br>Food is always awesome. Had the cajun shrimp pasta and the original cheesecake. <br><br>Very nice atmosphere. Highly recommended. But can get a little pricey. But it is worth it.

Horrible experience ordering takeout on Wednesday night. First I called in about 30 minutes ahead to make sure that my takeout would be ready for pick up. Pulled into the lot and parked at an empty stall. Immediately an attendant told me that I could not park there and I had to either valet or park in another lot farther down. I don&#39;t think so! There is no way I am parking that far to just to walk in and pick up my takeout! When I explained to him I was picking up, he said, &#34;You have 10 minutes.&#34; When I arrived at the pick up counter, my order was not ready. I waited for 20 minutes while he tries to locate my receipt. He assisted other customers as he waited for his manager to assist. Mind you, he did not bother to tell me this. He just started assisting other customers. When is manager arrived, his manager said &#34;So what do you want me to do about it?&#34; The guy at the register continued to assist other customers in line. He just ignored me and did not apologize for the wait or anything. He just looked frustrated. Even the customers in line noticed me waiting on the side and asked the if I had been helped. The employee replied, &#34;Yes, yes I am helping her.&#34; Really? How can you when you&#39;re helping other people? This location is the worst experience I&#39;ve had a Cheesecake Factory location.

will never go back - a party of 4   had a late lunch arriving at 1pm - we were<br>seated quickly - orders taken  - an hour later no food - an hour and a half later - food came - please understand our orders were simple - a salad, burger etc. nothing that took an hour plus to make.<br>My husband talked with the manager - who seem in another world - could have cared less -<br>no apology  or  reason - just a bad day for the staff- needless to say be aware of long wait times and very poor service.- food was just ok nothing special - parking -$4,00

What the eff. Why does it take so long to eat here? It seems like such a corporate-type place, so you would think that they might kind of understand my need to be back in my office within, oh, I dunno, say 2.5 hours? Why does a meal at the Cheesecake Factory always turn into a 3 hour affair? <br><br>I hate how they have ads in their menu. I hate how their menu is longer than most magazines. I hate how there&#39;s so much mediocre food on their menu that it takes my companions 12 hours to decide what they want.<br><br>The food there is actually pretty reliable. It doesn&#39;t taste bad. It&#39;s enough for two meals (although I usually don&#39;t want to eat it twice.) I like the chicken piccatta and the bang-bang chicken and shrimp-- if only for the name. It&#39;s a decent standby, but I&#39;d usually rather eat.... well... anywhere else.

I&#39;m giving two stars strictly because the food is consistently good , however the service here is horrendous . I&#39;ve been a Cheesecake Factory fan for almost 10 years so I hold them to high standard . I placed an order for pickup and my order was incorrect . I also specifically asked for wheat bread and only got white . I called back to let them know and was hung up on TWICE. After getting out and going to the counter I noticed the employees and manager were having conversation and never took notice to me until I had to waive for attention . They fixed my pasta and then I had to wait for them to bake a new loaf of wheat bread . This is the second time I&#39;ve had issues like this , for the price of food , service should be satisfactory , however at this location it isn&#39;t !

While admittedly the food at the Cheesecake Factory is amazing, the service &amp; consideration is below par. <br>We went for my birthday on Sunday. Our 30-45 min wait was over 1 hour. Our buzzer didn&#39;t go off, they claimed to have come outside &amp; called us, but during the hour I was outside the door, no staff EVER poked their head out. <br>Once we were finally seated, the hostess &amp; the server both offered bread, which neither ever brought. They did get the kid&#39;s food order in &amp; out quickly, but the Mac &amp; Cheese was as hot as lava &amp; they were starving given the long wait. <br>The coup de gras, was a bird pooping in my hair as we were wrapping up. Admittedly that&#39;s not the Cheesecake Factory&#39;s fault, but I think it speaks to our experience.

Hosted a friend&#39;s bridal shower here and...WOW!  I just need to extend my gratitude once again for the amazing job the manager Quinn and his staff provided for us, especially Steve!   They truly made this a memorable event.  Everyone had a great time and everything ended very smoothly.  The professionalism and kindness is incomparable! <br><br>I did hear about this man that had made some complaints about the noise.  Actually it was interesting many strangers at the valet said they were happy we had such a great time, but that man was upset.  It&#39;s unfortunate that people have to be negative like that, especially when his wife clearly wanted to join our party and never asked to be moved with a couple of other parties happening around at the same time.  It&#39;s already a loud restaurant.  I think he just wanted something to complain about...what a lame-o.
Good food like always, good service.<br><br>For some reason, the caesar salad I ordered was so so so good!! Lol it was like the best I ever ate! maybe i was too hungry? but it was oh soo yummy

LOVE LOVE LOVE this cheesecake factory, the location is perfect and very relaxing for a friends day out, night out or an evening date :). I love the staff here ive never experienced bad service, they are all very helpful, always a smile on their face. The food is delicious of course, excellent selection, plus i love the fact that they often edit their menu options, adding new delicious entrees and desserts, and omitting the not-so good ones. Order the tuna tartare and beet salad both really good!

Service has almost always been exceptional. The food is generally solid. I do however feel that the wait can be a little long when they&#39;re busy but that says something about the business. I am a repeat customer and I would recommend the Marina Del Rey location to any Cheesecake Factory lover.

Our waitress was horrible, I believe that I saw her twice throughout my entire meal, not to mention she also got mine, as well as my friends order wrong. I love going to Cheesecake Factory, but this one experience is making me want to stop going there. The only reason I am giving 2 stars is because the food is very good, but the service is TERRIBLE!

Normally we love this establishment, but we came to this particular one a couple of weeks ago and the service was terrible. The waiter was actually a nice guy, but his service was bad. Never brought drink refills, didn&#39;t split the check the way we asked, didn&#39;t bring out side dressing until asking multiple times. To top it off the chicken tenders tasted like rubber.
They need to get rid of Grace who works at the hostess station and answers the phone. Rude and an attitude that&#39;s not warranted given that we&#39;re talking about the Cheesecake Factory.

I love the plain cheesecake here with strawberries on top.  There are tons of innovative flavors, but the classic is definitely the best.  My other favorite dish is the hot spinach artichoke dip - it is practically a meal in itself.<br><br>This is a really nice location with lots of seating overlooking the marina.  I would probably come here just for the atmosphere and view even if I didn&#39;t love the food.<br><br>Parking is a bit annoying - you have the option of valet parking or self-parking for the same price, but the lot is crowded and you park in the same place as the valeted cars so it is weird to self-park.

I probably came to this location atleast 5 times this year since it&#39;s close to me. Of course the food is great, well atleast everything I ordered so far. Pastas, sandwiches, soups, salads. Love their anniversary cheesecake... BLUEBERRY! The indoor/outdoor seating overlooking the marina is lovely. cute fireplace. The wait here hasn&#39;t been that bad, for the most part, I usually get seated right away. Customer service is a hit or miss. Sometimes its great and sometimes they just seem to forget about you. If you&#39;re not sitting in a booth, then you&#39;re sitting close to other customers... which sucks.... because you can hear them fighting about which dessert to get. This one lady was fighting with her husband because she wanted the key lime cheesecake and he wanted a chocolate cake. LOL. crack me up.<br><br>What I don&#39;t like about this location is the &#34;Valet only&#34;. They don&#39;t have regular drive and park. So you have to deal w the valet guys and sometimes it&#39;s irritating...  Also one time I ordered a pasta dish and they didn&#39;t listen to my request and I got something else, so I made them redo my order which sucks when you&#39;re hungry.<br><br>4 stars for me! love their iced mango drink... I get it everytime!

I&#39;m not the biggest fan of Cheesecake Factory.  It had its heyday in the late 90s/early 00s.  I remember first coming to the Marina del Rey location back in the early 00s, and not much has changed since.  The portions are still enormous so you are better off just getting an entree. <br><br>The Cheesecake Factory menu is vast with so many varieties.  I&#39;ve ventured out several times, but I think you may be better served to just stick with dishes you like (because there are a lot of mediocre and even worse-than-mediocre dishes on the menu).  In terms of dessert, I&#39;m not a huge fan of cheesecake, but they have a few styles that aren&#39;t that bad.  The non-cheesecake dessert options are very average.<br><br>I&#39;ve also been here for brunch.  The food was just okay at brunch time.<br><br>In terms of this location, the service is kind of inconsistent.  The place gets incredibly busy, and some servers can handle it better than others.  The atmosphere at the Marina Del Rey location is great.  The indoor dining is nice, and the outdoor dining next to the water is also good.  One of the more interesting things about this location are the people who frequent it--you will see a lot of middle-aged men (or older) with some very young women (try and guess wife or daughter?).<br><br>The food at Cheesecake Factory really depends on what you order.  Some of it is better than others.  I recently had the miso salmon here, and it was pretty good.  If you know what&#39;s good, you should have (at the very least) a decent meal.  If you don&#39;t, all bets are off.  On the whole, a grade of 2.5 stars is probably fair.  Parking is valet.
Had so much food there, took left overs home. Huge menu, a lot of choices for every taste. Great service. Amazing quality of food. It was a good experience as every other time. Thank you

Went here for my birthday.<br><br>We tried to avoid eating outside because it was cold and looked rainy but with a party of 15, atleast a hour wait and a reservation not honored we couldn&#39;t avoid it. I got the shrimp skillet pasta; I don&#39;t know the exact name but it&#39;s in white sauce with lemon something flavors. Service was great; I enjoyed my food but I think had a little more fun swinging at the playground on the pier. Ladies if you have to use the bathrooms it&#39;s a long wait with two stalls plus they have a bathroom on the bottom by the firepit but its is  hideous and disgusting - I thought it was a horror movie.
oh six carb cheesecake<br>my sugar free addiction<br>I hate to love you

Beyond upset with this place.... the service was horrible. The waitress was rude. We ended up having an additional person join our party and the waitress did not offer to take a drink or food order. I came here twice and both times I have been completely disappointed with the service.

I should disclose that I love every Cheesecake Factory in the world. It&#39;s my #1 chain all-American restaurant, so this review is biased. That said, the seating indoors here sucks, unless you can get a stand alone booth. The patios, on the other hand, are awesome. If you&#39;re a tourist, want a nice view of the Marina, and know there&#39;s something on the menu you&#39;ll like, I suggest checking it out. The lower section is really nice, but the menu down there is limited so I don&#39;t go down there very often as they don&#39;t have the Cajun Chicken Little&#39;s on that menu (best chicken tenders in the world, don&#39;t argue).<br><br>Parking? Completely sucks. You shouldn&#39;t have to $5 valet at the CCF. We usually walk to our car and hand the valet the ticket since it&#39;s faster to do that then stand and wait for them to walk twenty feet to grab your car for you. SIlly. Park in the lot across from it and you can save $4 plus get your car faster.

Came here to have lunch with my cousins and we were seated promptly outside facing the beach. It was such a wonderful day and view!  I ordered a pulled pork sandwich that was delicious and flavorful. Service was a little spotty as our server looked like he was over his head with tables.<br><br>I&#39;m only taking a star away due to the valet parking. It&#39;s bad enough that you are forced to do it but worse when they charge for it.

I&#39;m really not a fan of this particular Cheesecake Factory. I mean don&#39;t get me wrong, the waitstaff was really nice, the outside area was nice and not too noisy. But the food was really poor in my opinion. My father and I had two different pastas, I had the Alfredo and he had some Cajun pasta dish. The Alfredo was very bland and the Cajun pasta had way too much spice. My mom ordered the catfish and was okay with it. <br><br>The only reason I would come back here is for the waitstaff but they seriously are nice, however it is kind of a long wait for the food.

Gorgeous day for a lazy, late Sunday lunch.  Despite the restaurant being full, we were seated immediately on the patio.  Our server, Steven, was very personable and attentive.  We both enjoyed our meals (pan-seared salmon, Thai chicken pasta) and the passionfruit infused unsweetened tea.  Loved the view of the marina; wish we could have lingered longer....

LOOOVE LOOOOOVE LLLOOOOOOVVVVVVEEEEE this restaurant!!<br>Not only is the cheescake factory without a doubt my favorite restaurant (and there are tons of reasons why), but the location is great! Its sits on the sandy front of the marina del rey harbor, with a nice jungle gym for the kids to play on while you wait for your table (or after dinner). Yes, expect to wait, especially on weekend nights. But just enjoy the scenery and the crowd, and in no time you will be sitting down to enjoy the best food ever.<br>The food is amazing, the selection is huge, and the portions are even bigger! And for how much food you get for your buck, the prices are VERY reasonable! The drinks are good, The service is always very friendly, the pre-meal bread is yummy, and all the appetizers are delicious. Actually, I have never eaten anything at the cheesecake that hasn&#39;t been up to standard. LOVE THIS RESTAURANT!!

It&#39;s hard to do wrong at the Cheesecake Factory. Honestly, the menu is a book, so if you don&#39;t like something, you can always order something else next time.<br><br>That said, the service is what makes or breaks a location, and the service at this location is amazing, at least when you have Delisa (spelling?) as a server. <br><br>We shared servings of the Lemon Ricotta Pancakes (at Delisa&#39;s recommendation, but only available during Sunday brunch) and the California Omelet. Both were delicious, but the pancakes were fluffy, and almost creamy. I know that&#39;s weird for a pancake, but it gave a nice tangy flavor along with fluff - amazing. <br>The omelette, while yummy, was relatively basic. The real star of that dish was the potatoes we got on the side. I know that sounds silly, but they were perfect.<br>Another yummy thing we has was their espresso, which was well made and sweet.<br><br>One thing that could VASTLY improve this location is their mandatory valet. You shouldn&#39;t HAVE to use valet at a Cheesecake Factory. This adds about $5 dollars (cost plus expected tip) to your total.
Since Killer Shrimp didn&#39;t work out, I went to this place and BRAVO! Excellent fast service. Excellent food! Thank you, Mike for saving my birthday &amp; being so friendly!
the factory burrito burger is sooo big and delicious with steak instead of chicken

Love this place. The restaurant has a beautiful outdoor patio looking out at the water and a little beach, quite beautiful especially during sunset time. Food is always great to me at any Cheesecake Factory and it applies here. However, service is always so slow. It takes 30-45 mins for your order to come. That&#39;s my only complaint, but they always balance it out by giving you a reliable appetizer of bread and butter before your order comes!
This place is busy. They always have good portions of food and the drinks are par. The outdoor seating is amazing.

Horrible service! Figured out that I had to pay $4.50 for parking when it wasn&#39;t even vallet, had to park it myself then they came up to me asking for money. Stood inside the restaurant for 10min no waiters paid us any attention to be seated. Our waiter came back twice saying he&#39;ll be back. Served our bread with no water. Didn&#39;t get to order after 20 min. Appetizer came with the meal which cancels out the part for it to be an APPETIZER. Came at 11:10pm didn&#39;t get to leave until 1am.

There are a couple uncomfortable things you can do when you work in a restaurant that will make not only a bad, but akward experience for a customer. Employees fighting, people that man the phones taking personal calls in front of customers etc. I found out another one last night when My GF and I went to this place around 930 for dinner. It was busy so they quoted a half hour wait but did say there was open seating at the bar...we saw two people get up so we figured if there was a full menu it would do. We sat down and their were two bartenders working, one stocky guy with a beard that was going a mile a minute and a young looking asian girl who was barely doing anything. Took about 10 mins to be acknowledged and then got our drinks placed next to the previous customers dirty plates (asked if he could clear it for us and was met with the response of &#34;will get to that in one second&#34;). After we got our food we might as well have been invisible, needed a couple of things (tobasco, salt and pepper) and had to ask one of the waiters walking by, he looked annoyed and shouted at the bartender to come over and help us. The thing that made it akward was we kept noticing the girl bartender talking to two other patrons for most of our visit and ignoring pretty much everyone and everything else. We didn&#39;t put two and two together till she started EATING off the peoples plate and other employees kept stopping by and saying hi to them. It was then obvious that these were other employees on there off time and the bartender was better served eating with them and talking about how she had gone here and there the night before then making sure we had condiments for our food. This went on for literally the entire hour we were eating, my GF kept looking at me in shock like &#34;they are really carrying on and we can&#39;t even get our card run so we can leave&#34;. Some places do not allow employees to fraternize at work in their off hours, I never agreed with that but there is a fine line where professionalism is lost because you want to BS with your co worker...this is not good practice in the restaurant business. The food was very good, but we got the basic apps and a piece of cheescake (kind of hard to F%$k that up). One star for the food but the rest was as bad as I&#39;ve seen in a while, unfortunately will probably go back because they do serve food late...will just make sure to sit in the dining room this time.

This is a chain restaurant - so you should know what you&#39;re getting yourself into going in. The only benefit about the Marina location is that it is on the water, which is nice, but can get chilly at night and I have never been sat anywhere inside where you can actually view the water.<br><br>This place is ALWAYS packed, the parking lot is LITERALLY a parking lot, even as you&#39;re trying to leave, and as far as I can tell, you HAVE to valet, even though you could easily park your car yourself. Expect a wait here, no matter what.<br><br>As has been said, the food is mediocre. Any place that gives you a choice of ANYTHING (Mexican, Italian, American, Asian) is clearly unfocused and anything you order comes out as such. I have only dinned here because I was with a group of friends and the only reason I had a decent time was because of the company I was with. Oh, and they make decent drinks and duh, the cheesecake is really good (the only thing they really seem to have a handle on).

Well this place gets so crowded and the property so small that you have to valet park. We were surprisingly seated right away, it was Cinco de mayo so I anticipate that everyone was at a Mexican restaurant instead. It was pretty full though and there were a lot of birthdays as the staff sang happy birthday 5 times during our dinner.<br><br>Courses were better than usual, around the table we had: jambalaya, salad, flatiron steak and fries and I ordered off of their new mini appetizer menu which totally reminded me of what you would get at a tapas restaurant.  Appetizers I got were a spicy sausage with sun dried tomato and mashed potatoes - the sausage patties, though tasty, seemed incredibly undercooked so I only had a couple of bites then moved them around my plate so no one would try to convince me to return them - DH gave me a wonderful phobia of returning food since restaurant folk like to do nasty things to your food.  I also got parmesan stuffed dates wrapped in bacon which was good but would have been great if it were hot.<br><br>Finished off with some coffee and their 30th anniversary cheesecake, which is my favorite.  Hostess took away a chair from our table though while someone was in the bathroom and didn&#39;t even ask and gave it to another table.<br><br>Seriously, what&#39;s wrong with people?  Why are common sense things so difficult sometimes - hello service industry?  Oh, right - high school.

If you&#39;re visiting the Marina area, it&#39;d be a shame to waste your money here. There are overwhelming numbers of solid places in the Marina -- look around. <br><br>It&#39;s what you&#39;d expect. Certainly over-priced, but you&#39;re kind of paying for the name and the atmosphere. <br><br>If you get sucked into a group outing to the place -- which is likely, then get a big salad -- they do good salads. Other than that, the food is just average.

I&#39;ve been here a few times, but only now am I beginning to realize that the Cheesecake Factory is very overpriced.<br><br>The food is good, sure. It&#39;s even manufacturedly exotic at times. But it&#39;s not great. My $40 bill for a Cesar salad, half of some crappy calamari, and a glass of wine demands better quality.<br><br>And at the end of the day, the Factory is just a dolled chain with a menu similar to CPK and P.F. Changs. They are all owned by the same company, after all.<br><br>I&#39;m tired of the Cheesecake Factory allowing people to think themselves cultured.

One of the few cheesecakes I go to ONLY if people are visiting and only one in a 15 mile radius.  Otherwise, I stay away from this place at all cost.  Not sure where to start but I&#39;l give it a try.<br><br>1) Why is it valet parking is like 5 bucks and I don&#39;t think there is validation or it matters....yet when the parking lot is empty and you can practically park yourself, you still are stuck paying the valet to park your car.  LAME.<br><br>2) Moving on into the restaurant, the layout is just horrible.  The entrance that is and then when the weather is nice, the tables are squished together to get as many people into that place as possible. <br><br>3) Service: The servers are not the brightest tool in the shade.  Many are rude and pushy.  More short with the customers if they take too long to decide on their order.  <br><br>4) Air conditioner is always pitched up no matter what season it is.  Just because it is socal, why is it always feel like it&#39;s about 60 degrees in there?  <br><br>5) I ordered a simple salad and even that came wrong and I waited another 45 minutes for them to bring me the right order.  The rest of the dining party was waiting for me to finish.  Ridiculous I tell you.  Also, many of the servers were unprofessional talking about how much tip they were getting from the customers as they walked out (and we walked to our table)....whatever happened to appropriate dining etiquette and serving etiquette?  The managers need to do some serious training at that location.<br><br>If you&#39;re close and craving to eat at cheesecake, don&#39;t go to this one.  Find a different one to eat at.
I love this place... feels like perfect evening every time I get here for dinner :)

Great location, food and service. It is my go to place to bring family from out of town. As this is a chain, you won&#39;t get anything too edgy, but that&#39;s a good thing when you have picky eaters. The menu is massive and there&#39;s bound to be something for everyone.

This is the best location out of all locations, because you get a view of the Harbour and can walk outside and dine on the patio overlooking the beach.  My kids love this beach, with it&#39;s playground and calm water, after a good meal it&#39;s a real treat! <br>Service is always excellent here, and the food is always good.
This spot is still my fav go-to spot! There is no street parking only valet.  Try the bloody mary!!

So my friend and I decided we wanted to try this particular restaurant. We sat outside to be able to view the marina and it was real nice. However we weren&#39;t too pleased about how crowded the seats and tables are. So many tables practically making it seem instead a party of 2 its a party of 4! You can&#39;t have a private conversation. All night I could  hear the couple next to us talk about her friend and her this and that and don&#39;t get me started on our waiter. Was it because he was new or nervous or not focused, he forgot to bring our wine and never bothered to ask us if everything was fine or if we would like another glass. We had to ask the guy who brought out our food. Never even asked if we needed anything else. I was so close in not giving him a tip. Zero stars for him. The food however is awesome! I tried the Jamaican black pepper shrimp, it was to die for..alot of flavor with just the right amount of spice...4 stars for the food..

What a view!!!<br><br>Sit outside to see the Marina. Wow. <br><br>Service is also good and staff is more than friendly.<br><br>This is why this is my favorite restaurant chain, food is good and quality is excellent.<br><br>Just get in a cardio session before you come so you don&#39;t feel guilty.

Okay ... so I&#39;ve been going to Cheesecake Factory for many years now ... and quite frequently too ... once every 2 to 3 weeks ... so you can see I am a fan.  Never bothered to write a review in all these years.  So what prompted me to write this review, you might ask ... well, it was the blunder they made with my last dine-in order.  Blunder? ... and still 5 stars? well, yes ... I think they deserve it.<br><br>My wife and I went for a dinner last week.  Everything from waiting to seating to order-taking to appetizer service was going well ... till our entrees arrived.  Chicken Bellagio  is originally served with prosciutto.  I don&#39;t eat pork so I specifically asked for NO prosciutto.  In fact, although I have Cheesecake Factory&#39;s gigantic menu pretty much all memorized, and although I know what menu items have pork and cooking alcohol in them, as a matter of habit, I always mention my waiter that I don&#39;t eat pork and can&#39;t have any alcohol, so if I order an item that contains either pork or alcohol, please caution me.  That night was no exception.<br><br>When the dish was served, there was this big slice of prosciutto on top.  When I mentioned that I ordered it without prosciutto, the girl who brought out the food took it right back and told me that they will quickly prepare it again.  Seconds later our waiter was there apologizing and a minute later the manager was at our table side apologizing and offering chowder while I waited for the dish to be prepared again, not knowing that we had already ordered chowder earlier (and it was delicious).<br><br>Now I can see all this when a customer is visibly upset or loud, but I was neither upset nor did I complain loudly.  I was, for some reason, simply in too good a mood to let anything this small ruin it.<br><br>I have always enjoyed their food, which I must mention, is always plentiful, and I have always admired their excellent service ... and I look forward to being their customer for a long time.<br><br>They didn&#39;t comp me for the dish.  They didn&#39;t comp the dessert either (a slice of tiramisu cheesecake) that my wife and I shared, which I find slightly surprising.  But they still get 5 stars from me for both food and service.<br><br>PS: I am disappointed on closure of their Brentwood location.  I never dined there but picked up food from there as take-out almost on a weekly basis.

What can i say.... It&#39;s the Cheesecake Factory....COMMERCIAL food. However, the Sante Fe Chicken salad is/was my favorite. The consistency varies by location. It can be hit or miss. Menu is large with all the high calorie fattening dishes.<br><br>LOUD and always packed with a full bar. I actually heard one woman make the following statement. &#34;there&#39;s too much artichoke in the artichoke dip&#34;  ROFL..... I really thought she was kidding but she wasn&#39;t.<br><br>Cheesecake&#39;s are great.
These are the best cheesecake I ever had, and the food is also great. The service is amazing, love to come here with the family, is super nice

Although this place is often uncomfortably crowded and can be a pain in the booty, I still come back....Although I&#39;m pretty sure my fam is over it.<br><br>Anyway, I&#39;m a cheesecake lover, and although the menu has a great variety of food (some may say too much variety), I&#39;ve been stuck on the Louisiana Chicken Pasta for a few years now.  <br><br>And when it comes to the cheesecake?  Don&#39;t get me started.  I&#39;m pretty sure you can&#39;t make a bad decision here, although you will have your favorites.  The Adam&#39;s Peanut Butter Cup Fudge Ripple, Vanilla Bean, Dulce De Leche, and Cookie Dough cheesecakes are amongst my fave. <br><br>They have plenty of cocktails as well.  Their mojitos are pretty delicious, particularly the pomegranate one. <br><br>There&#39;s a Cheesecake Factory all over the place, and while a little pricey, it&#39;s still delish.  <br><br>If you are coming here with a group, DEFINITELY come early and be prepared to WAIT.  They don&#39;t take reservations.  Normally at lunch time, it will be easier to  get a table.  There&#39;s my lil tip.
Only came here for dessert Cheesecake covered with Strawbwerries Yuuuumstersssss whew enjoy....

I had the Nutty Marshmallow spiked milkshake. It was AWESOME with little chunks of marshmallows in it. Both of our pasta dishes were tasty too - Jambalaya and Louisiana Chicken. Kandace was our server and was awesome too. <br><br>Valet parking is mandatory and cost us $4.50 for an hour. Not too bad for valet parking, but we did have to wait a bit for our car at the end of the night - probably 10 to 15 mins as there were a lot of people waiting in front of us.

I&#39;m not exactly sure why I am even giving this two stars, maybe from prior experiences?  Well... There was an hour wait, which I guess would be normal for a Sunday night but I have never waited more than about 20 minutes here, ever!  So it&#39;s my birthday and Mother in Law wanted to take me out, so I suggested the usual Cheesecake Factory as I do every year!  So after the horrendous wait, we get seated and told the &#34;specials&#34; from the server filling in for the normal server.  I order the salmon special and my husband and mom order their meals.  About ten minutes in and the lights dimmed so much we are all amused at the fact that we can barely see each other and the table next to us is passing around a cell phone with their flashlight on to read the menu.  I&#39;m now told from the normal server that she is so sorry but they are out of salmon!  So I ask to see the menu again and quickly decide on a pasta from the heading because at this point I can&#39;t read what is under it due to the lighting.... I ask her what is a good past with a white sauce that I can take out the meat?  So I decide on Farfalle with chicken and roasted garlic... And please hold the chicken. Totally put on pressure to pick something else quickly. Now I don&#39;t eat meat but I do eat fish, so I ask to hold the chicken.  I get my meal and start eating.  What am I chewing on cause I can&#39;t see my food? I put my flashlight on and it&#39;s covered in pancetta.  Apparently in small print there&#39;s pancetta.  I waive down the server and she apologizes that she did not think to ask if pancetta would be okay when I asked to hold the chicken.  (Assuming someone would be vegetarian when asking to hold meat).  So okay my fault, she takes it back to be remade without meat.  I get my new meal. IT IS EXACTLY THE SAME! Covered in meat again! The server apologizes over and over and sends for another meal. By this time my husband and mom are finished eating and waiting on me.  We have now been there about two and a half hours.  I&#39;ve picked at the bread and spinach dip enough that I&#39;m now full.  So we ask for boxes and a check.  Come to find.... We were charged for my meal!  Seriously?  I&#39;m so disappointed in my &#34;birthday&#34; experience that no one even feels like challenging the check.  But really... Your going to charge me for that!?! Well Happy Birthday to me I guess.  Can&#39;t get that day back!
A couple times I got sick dinning in this place.<br>Big plates, food not good. There is better chains for the same money with better food.

This place is super! If you haven&#39;t visited, you are missing out. here&#39;s some free cash to try it out. <br><br><a href="/redir?url=http%3A%2F%2Fbit.ly%2Fcheesecakefactory-giftcard&amp;s=993c4c047ee69462810f8faf03a994e2f7d0f9f19366efd3af675b2172301b28" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">bit.ly/cheesecakefactory…</a>

such an incredible location , wow. we sat at the outside patio overlooking the beach and the marina for a sunday breakfast and had a great time , we happened to arrive when they opened so no waiting time surprisingly . the food was good, like at any other cheesecake location .

I hate this Cheesecake Factory. Hate it. And usually, it takes very little to satisfy me, so this location just sucks. I&#39;m not deluding myself, this is a CHEESECAKE factory. Where there be a Westfield Mall, there shall be one! ... So I&#39;m not expecting 5 star dining or anything, just my usual standard fare.<br><br>The first thing --- Valet parking ONLY. Wtf? What if I want to park the car myself? It also takes longer to get my car through valet than just walking out the door onto the lot. The fact that you have to pay $4.50 for the service as well is just a slap in the face. Sure, maybe for many in this area, $4.50 is chump change but I just hate that is was mandatory! It was $4.50 for dinner, from what I read, lunch valet is cheaper.<br><br>We went on a Sunday evening. We were driving back from San Pedro and we were starving! Our options were the Redondo Beach location or this one, else wait for the long drive back to Thousand Oaks and eat there (we couldn&#39;t wait). We asked for a table for two inside, were told 30mins, took a pager but found a table at the bar and as we were sitting, our pager buzzed. Huh? Why tell us 30mins? It didn&#39;t matter either way because we were fine with the bar table but we had sat and then had to get up and wait 5mins to be seated again.<br><br>Our server and service were minimal. We weren&#39;t dressed to impress, that&#39;s for sure, since we were on Catalina Island for most part of the day. I wonder if that was why? We got what we needed I guess ... just took a little bit of a wait.<br><br>I ALWAYS order a side of sweet potato fries for an appetizer (sometimes as my meal, but shhhh).
